She is planning on building and opening a small grocery store next year so that she can increase her income and pay for her children’s tuition fees more easily. E. is requesting a 3,770,000 tugrug (~2650 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat for her business during the upcoming winter months.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat for her business during the upcoming winter months

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. is from the city of Biray Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old, married and has an infant child. Arlene's main source of income comes from her food production and retailing business which she has operated for over two years. She makes foods such as bananacues (grilled banana), hot cakes, and binignits. Her business generates approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlene joined GDMPC to access their financial services in an effort to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be Arlene's first GDMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn S., 42, is married and lives with her three school-aged children and husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She used to sell groceries in her village but business was not good. As a result, she started a new business selling fruit in the city. She has been involved in this business since 2008 and is able to earn US $5 per day. Her husband (in the photo) drives a motorbike in the city earning US $4 per day. Her husband helps with her business every morning, preparing to sell to their regular customers, then he travels around the city offering his transportation services.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. As a result, she is requesting a loan of US $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. This is her first loan from CREDIT. She wants to use the loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old motorbike often goes broken.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor spare-sparts in bulk

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., age 38, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of groceries in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2000. Her husband is a construction worker, earning a gross income of US$ 15 per day.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Amenaghawon

texts.en: Amenaghawon sells planks. She has been in this business for eight years. She is a friendly and happy woman. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 49 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a businessman. Amenaghawon is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Analia Mabel

texts.es:
La Srta. Analía M. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es soltera, vive con sus padres, en la compañía de Caazapá.

   Analía manifiesta que desde muy jóven empezó a trabajar en el oficio de la artesanía junto con su madre, hoy día ella lo realiza sola ya que su madre sufre de una enfermedad.

  Debido a la gran aceptación que tiene sus productos y teniendo en cuenta que se acerca el invierno, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de hilos y color que son los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de sus sobrecamas ya que ha recibido muchos pedidos y de esta manera podrá satisfacer demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Analía M. is from the city of Carapeguá. She is single, and she lives with her parents in the Caazapá neighborhood. Analía says that when she was very young she started working in the handicrafts field with her mother. Now she does it alone because her mother is ill. Due to the great acceptance of her products, and keeping in mind that winter is coming, she approached the Fundación Paraguaya to ask for a new loan. The loan is to buy thread and color, which are the materials needed to make her bedspreads. She has received a lot of orders, and this way she will be able to satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en:
Tailoring is a business that has brought joy to Osaretin. All these are seen in the success the business has brought to his life. People from different parts of his city patronize his business. He also sells tailoring materials and sarongs to boost his profit. He hopes for a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell.

At 26, Osaretin is married with 2 children. They live in Edo State, Nigeria. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Daariimaa

texts.en:
Daariimaa B. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her oldest two daughters attend a local secondary school and her youngest son is in primary school. Her husband, Balsanjav, works as a solderer for a private company.
Daariimaa operates a shoe trading business at Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in the city. She started her business in 2005 with capital of 500,000 MNT after moving to the city from Hovd province in far western Mongolia where she operated a cashmere business. Since 2005, she has grown her business successfully and today her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT.
Daariimaa is an industrious person with good business sense. She has used her business to greatly improve her family's quality of life. She has used her profits to build a new house for her family. Daariimaa has many plans for the future and hopes to save money this summer so she can pay her children's education fees. She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase another counter at the market as well as new shoes to sell that she will import from China.

loans.use: To purchase another counter at the market and new shoes for resale

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Mrs. Hing M. is 39 years old and is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectare of land where she cultivates rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Samnang Brakk, is a police officer who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to increase income to improve the family's living standard, Mrs. Hing M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crops.

The couple has two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and also to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité  Virgen de Fatima está integrada por mujeres del barrio Santa Rosa de la zona urbana de la ciudad de Ybycuí, departamento de Paraguarí, está compuesta  por 15 miembros  entre ellas se encuentran mujeres quienes tienen actividades  como , ventas de remedio naturales, comidas , frutas, carne de cerdo, ropas usadas y otras  se dedican a la ventas de lencerías; entre ellas también existen  mujeres  quienes desean emprender otras actividades ya que todas son  de escaso recursos.
          El comité demostró la intención de trabajar  para salir adelante,  se han comprometido en ser solidarias  y responsables ante las situaciones que se puedan presentar. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Francisca quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ya el consumo de los mismos es bastante alto especialmente en las épocas de invierno.
Primeramente ella realiza la compra de los remedios en bolsas de 20 kg. Luego lo empaqueta en bolsitas más pequeñas para venderlo.
Sus productos ella los ofrece en varios negocios de la zona así ella consigue un ingreso periódico para ayudar a su familia,
Solicita el crédito para la compra de varias bolsas de remedios naturales.
texts.en:
The Virgin of Fatima Committee consists of women from the urban neighborhood of Santa Rosa in the city of Ybycuí, department of Paraguarí. This group consists of 15 members. These women have businesses selling natural remedies, food, fruit, pork, used clothing, and lingerie. The group also includes women who want to pursue other business activities since they all have limited resources.

The Committee members have demonstrated their intention to work in order to get ahead. They have promised to cooperate with one another and be responsible in all situations that are presented before them.

One of the members is Sra. Francisca, who sells natural remedies. The consumption of these products is especially high during the winter season. In order to sell these remedies, she must first purchase them in 20kg bags and then package them in much smaller bags before making them available to her customers. Her products are sold to different businesses in the area and generate a regular income to help support her family. Francisca is requesting a loan to buy bags of different natural remedies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural remedies in 20kg bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the labor on the construction of a room for his house

loans.name: Cotton's Business Group

texts.en:
Tenneh J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Cotton's Business”. Tenneh lives in Montserrado County and is served by the Monrovia North branch of this MFI. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two children who range from 18 to 24 years old. Tenneh was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.

For twenty years, Tenneh has been selling lappas (traditional dress for women), gents’ and ladies’ trousers, blouses, underwear, etc. in Harbel Cotton Tree community, Margibi County, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more lappas, gents’ and ladies’ trousers, blouses, underwear, etc.

Tenneh describes herself as easy-going. Her dream is to expand her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, J. T. is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more lappas, gents' and ladies' trousers, blouses, underwear, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jo-Ane

texts.en:
This is Jo-Ane S., 39, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marzan, a painter, and is the mother of a child currently enrolled in elementary school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to support her child’s schooling all the way through college. This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Jo-Ane, as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children. Jo-Ane is a licensed nurse.

Jo-Ane maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 13,000 in sales every month. Jo-Ane also incorporates frozen cuts of meat and native meat delicacies to her current business inventory. She offers sweetened hams, pork sausages and cured beef.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Jo-Ane has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for four years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings.*

Jo-Ane dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She hopes to see her child receive his own college diploma.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en:
Inocenta M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 52 years old. Inocenta is single. To make a living, Inocenta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Inocenta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

Inocenta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Inocenta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Inocenta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg O. is 41 years old, a married woman with three daughters. She lives with her family in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her older two daughters, 20 and 18, are students and they live and study in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her younger daughter, 16, attends a local high school, while her husband is currently unemployed. 

Altantsetseg operates a traveling goods-selling business in her town. She usually purchases her products from wholesale stores at the town market and sells those products in the local community for a profit. Over the many years of operation, she has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. She is a hard-working, modest woman who  would like to keep growing her business. Her goals are to provide for her daughters' education and to have her own workplace in the future. 

Altantsetseg needs more money to pay her daughters' tuition as well as their rent, therefore she is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To pay her daughters' tuition fees

loans.name: Evelyn Emperatriz

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo de Guayaquil la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Hace 5 años atrás ella inicio su papelería comprando unos cuadernos pequeños y vendiendo en la temporada escolar. Desde ese tiempo ha surtido su papelería  trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Vende papelería, cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc.  

El quiere con el préstamo comprar cuadernos y papelería. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio mas grande y surtido para asegurar la vida económica de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Evelyn has a stationary store in the front of her home that is in an urban area called Guasmo of Guayaquil, the majority of the inhabitants are informal merchants.

Some 5 years ago, Evelyn began her stationary store by buying small notebooks and selling them during the school season. From that time she has worked in her stationary store by working from 8:00 a.m until 8 p.m. everyday. She sells stationary, notebooks, pens, covers, etc.

She needs the loan to buy notebooks and stationary. In the future she wants her business to be bigger and stocked to secure the economic future of her two children.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, papers.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. For a living, she sells fish. She was previously selling grains for a living. Pamela also sells vegetables to earn extra income. In her business, she has employed one person.  

She has managed to expand her business, hence raising her living standards through Faulu Kenya. She hopes to venture into another business in five years. With the loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, she will buy tomatoes, cabbages and fish.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cabbages and fish

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es:
Glenda vive en la zona Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es empleada, trabaja por las mañanas en el Megacenter (Centro Comercial más grande La Paz) como vendedora, y por las tardes se dedica a la elaboración de Caleidoscopios, en su domicilio
Es soltera e independiente.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de tubos espejos, papel sticker, tapas de plástico y tubos de ensayo), para continuar con su actividad independiente.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos, y mejorar la cantidad de producción de los caleidoscopios.
texts.en:
Glenda lives in the Obrajes area in the city of La Paz.  She is employed, and in the morning works in the Megacenter (the largest commercial center in La Paz) as a salesperson, and in the evenings she makes kaleidoscopes in her home.  She is single and lives by herself.

The credit will be used for capital (buying tubes, mirrors, stickers, plastic lids, and test tubes) to continue with her independent activities.

This is the second loan she has requested from Impro.  Her payment history classifies her as a good client.  With this loan she will be able to increase her income and increase the quantity of kaleidoscopes she produces.

loans.use: Purchase of materials like tubes, mirrors, stickers, and plastic lids for her kaleidoscope business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 52 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno. Hace más de 33 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y le gusta mucho realizar esta actividad. Santos se levanta todos los días para empezar su ardua labor, para conseguir más ingresos decidió invertir en los productos necesarios para la elaboración de las cosas de hornados. Con el préstamo quiere comprar leña, maíz, azúcar, bolsas entre otras cosas. En el futuro quiere ayudar a sus hijos que tengan una educación más digna.
texts.en: Santos is 52. Her job is the making and sales of 'cosa de horno' [a typical Nicaraguan pastry]. She has had this business for over 33 years. She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys this work very much. Santos gets up every day to begin her day of arduous work. In order to make more income, she decided to invest in the necessary products for the making of ceramics. With this loan she wants to buy firewood, corn, sugar, and bags, among other items. In the future she wants to help her children to have a more decent education.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Araba Tamfo Mary

texts.en: Araba Tamfo Mary Y. is a widow. She fried fish for sale at Abura. She has been in this trade for three years. The income she generates from her sales is used to take care of herself. Araba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to fry to expand her business.

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat, 31 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  They all live in a house. Her elder two daughters are attending local secondary school, and the youngest daughter stays at home. She has been operating a  retail business selling accessorized felt boots since 2000. She purchases felt boots and accessorizes them for resale. She adopted this business from her husband, and after years of operation, she has managed her working capital and with the earnings she purchased a family car and a plot of land for the house which they built recently. 

In the summer time she also operates a different business, a leather saddle cloth making business with her husband. Now her business is getting busy and she already has her regular customers who buy accessorized felt boots. In the future she is planning to expand her business and to have her own factory. Therefore she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase 200 pairs of felt boots to accessorize.

loans.use: loan to purchase 200 pairs of felt boots to accessorize

loans.name: Mujeress Divinass Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama MUJERESS DIVINASS y es de Puebla, en México Está comformado por 10 integrantes. En el grupo esta la señora Isela M.T. quien es la tesorera del grupo. Ella es madre soltera con 2 hijos; de 11 y 8 años, ambos dependenden de ella. Isela estudió la secundaria, es comerciante de ropa de dama, sus ventas son en cambaceo con la gente de la comunidad, y los dias sábados tiene un puesto en su domicilio que esta accesible para los clientes, los cuales dicen que el trato de Isela es siempre amable y cordial hacia con ellos. En este momento quiere el crédito para comprar ropa de invierno y aprovechar para tener mejores ingresos y asi seguir apoyando a sus hijos, porque Isela quiere dejarles a sus hijos en un futuro un negocio estable y bien aclientalado, que les genere ingresos para solventar sus gastos y construir un proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called MUJERES DIVINAS (DIVINE WOMEN) and is in Puebla, México.  It has 10 members.  Mrs. Isela M. T. is in the group; she is the Treasurer

She is a single mother of two children who are 11 and 8 years of age; both depend on her.  Isela finished secondary school and is a ladies clothes merchant.  Her sales are door to door among people in the community.  On Saturdays she sets up a stand at home that is accessible to customers who say that Isela’s service is always kind and cordial.

She currently needs a loan to buy winter clothing to take advantage of to have better income and continue to support her children because Isela wants to leave her children a stable, well patronized business in the future that will generate income to cover expenses and to build a life project.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Anelly

texts.en:
Anelly K. D. is a 44 year old lady. She is married to Charo and they have been blessed with two children. Anelly has been a clothes vendor for the last one year in Mombasa area. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD which she plans to use to purchase more clothes for reselling into her business. From the anticipated profits, she plans to re-invest the profit by adding more stock into the business. 

Her dream is to expand her business and employ more workers.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S., age 62, is a mother blessed with six children. Most of her children are employed in various jobs and they always contribute their profit to her to use for the family expenses. Her husband is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses at the mobile place, Kompong Thom Province. Sor S. currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day by selling Khmer cake in the village. Besides selling Khmer cake, Sor S. has been in the farming business for a long time. This is the good time for planting her dry-season rice field, but her old cow doesn't support her field work. That is the reason why Sor S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.name: Pashan

texts.en: Pashan is currently in the business of selling perfumes. She is 38 years old, married to a policeman, and has one child, who attends school. Pashan took out a loan to stock more perfumes to sell. With the extra profits from her business, Pashan hopes to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to stock more perfumes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 33 años de edad, reside en San Isidro departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de libros hace 10 meses, los vende con los vecinos y amigos del lugar en un horario de 8:00am a 5:00pm. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar bloques y cemento y comenzar la construcción de su vivienda.
Este préstamo le ayudara a contar con los materiales necesarios y llevar a cabo la construcción de su casa, ya que de esta manera vivirá más cómodamente con su familia.
El sueño principal de Antonia es finalizar la construcción de su vivienda, para luego seguir trabajando por ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 33 years old and lives in San Isidro, Department of Morazán.  She lives with her spouse and two children, ages 4 and 2.  She has been selling books for 10 months.  She sells them to neighbors and friends at a place from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.  

She is requesting a loan to buy blocks and cement to start construction on her home.  This loan will help her have the necessary materials to carry out the construction of her home, which will allow her to live more comfortably with her family.  Antonia's main dream is to finish building her home, so that she can continue working to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase blocks and cement.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K. is 55 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school and two of whom are working.  Sok K. makes her living by planting rice on her own farmland, which she has been doing for over 10 years. Her husband is a domestic construction foreman. Sok K. wants to build one small room in her house for her relatives or others guests to use when they come to visit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, brick, sand, iron, and other necessary equipment for building.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support five children. Luzviminda is married and has an entertainment (videoke) business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional videoke unit.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Luzviminda would like to send her children to school and save.

loans.use: to purchase an additional videoke unit

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien T. T. is 30 years old and has two children who attend high school. She did farming when her children were young and mostly focused on growing rice and vegetables and raised chickens for meat. Because these agricultural activities would meet her family's food needs. 

Being a client of our credit program since 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding her farm. Because of this reason, her loan sizes have been higher year after year. 

Now, she needs to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy fertilizer and food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and food for chickens

loans.name: Isai

texts.en:
Isai is a 38 year-old man who has lived in the village of Pasir Panjang for almost 20 years. His everyday work is to sell fish. He is married to Feby and blessed with 5 children, namely:
1.\t Indri, 14 years old, who is in the 3rd grade of Junior high school
2.\tCindri, 11 years old ,who is in the 1st grade of Junior high school
3.\tAndri, 8 years old, in the 1st grade of Elementary school
4.\tIndra, 6 years old, not at school yet 
5.\tLucky, 2 years old, not at school yet 

Isai has been a fish monger for almost 15 years. He had worked as a motorcycle taxi driver, but because of the little income, he decided to sell fish. He also has a small kiosk located by the edge of the street, about 1 km from his house. Sometimes he has to sleep in his kiosk, accompanied by his wife and his youngest son while his other children stay at home. 

The income from selling fish is not much. The average of his daily income is about IDR 50,000. This income is not sufficient for Isai to meet the needs of his family, as he still needs to pay the school fees of his children. Therefore, Isai has tried to find other ways to increase his income by selling grilled fish. In order to do so, Isai needs capital assistance to buy the equipment to grill fish. In addition, he will also need to buy a variety of fish to grill. Isai is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. He hopes the application will be approved so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment to grill fish, and a variety of fish to grill

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en: Amalya A. lives in Vanadzor with her husband. Amalya’s three daughters are already married and live separately from their parents. Amalya works as a nurse and simultaneously she and her husband have been running their shop for more than 6 years. They sell towels, bedspreads, tableware, kitchen utensils, tea items, vases, souvenirs, etc. Their business’s incomes make it possible to provide for their family. Amalya needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy dishes, tea and coffee sets, pans, etc. to resell. This is Amalya's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy dishes, tea and coffee sets, pans, etc. to resell

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria Dolores es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Cerrito, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Pastor Severiano de 67 años de edad. Actualmente tienen 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad, trabajan independientemente.
Posee una despensa, también trabaja como vendedora ambulante, artículos de mercerías y bijouteries, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, es una señora muy trabajadora.
La cliente con este crédito pretende comprar mercaderías que va desde ropas hasta artículos para el hogar y alimentos imperecederos para tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
María Dolores is from the city of San Estanislao’s Cerrito neighborhood.  She’s 47 years old, married to Pastor Severiano, 67.  They have four adult children who work independently.

She has a store and also works as a street vendor selling notions and costume jewelry.  She has an established clientele, good income and good personal and business references; she is a very hard working woman.

She intends to use this loan to buy assorted notions that range from clothing to article for the home and also perishable food items to have better income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell as well as to buy rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 32 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as juice, coffee and cereals.  In the future Milagros would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married, and has one child.

In 2005 Mohamad opened a mobile phone store, selling phones, accessories, and recharge cards. He has a good reputation and he is committed to his work and loyal to his clients.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to buy a laptop and a photocopier. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a laptop and a photocopier.

loans.name: José Amadeo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Américas se reúne cada quince días en  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde tiempos coloniales  como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, por la inmensa cantidad de arboles de esta fruta de ahí este nombre, con el que se lo conoce hasta la actualidad.

Aquí conocimos a don José, tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad el mismo que estudia en colegio. Su mujer se dedica a las labores del hogar. 

Don José se  dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado los días de feria. Nos cuenta que esto lo realiza los tres últimos días de la semana, él se va el jueves  a los campos a comprar los productos directamente de los agricultores para que le salga más barato y luego los lleva al mercado a distribuirlos tanto al por mayor como al menudeo. Lleva dedicado a esta actividad tres años ya que en los otros días y desde hace muchos años también se dedica a realizar servicios de transporte escolar.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Él está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y está muy contento por la ayuda que recibe tanto del banco como de la institución.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión más grande y poder llevar productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Américas” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known since colonial times as the city of “Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantity of tamarind trees that continue to exist today.

It is here that one can meet Don José. He is 56 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a 14-year-old son who is in high school. His wife takes care of the household duties.

Don José sells fruits and legumes at the market on the days when the fair is in session. He says that he sells during the last three days of the week. On Thursdays, he goes to the fields to buy products directly from the farmers since he can get a cheaper price. He then takes his goods to market where he can sell in bulk and in smaller amounts. José has been in business for three years. For many years he has also been providing transportation services for school children on the days he is not running his business.

This loan will be used to buy fruits, vegetables, and legumes. José has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and is very pleased with the assistance he has received from both the Communal Bank and Fundación ESPOIR.

His dream is to buy a larger truck so that he can bring his products to other cities.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and legumes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-aged dependents. Marilyn is a farmer. She owns and operates a business planting rice and harvesting palay. She has been engaged in this business for over five years. Every quarter, she earns a total of PHP 15,000 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to pay for the labor cost for land preparation and to purchase seedlings to be planted this coming planting season.

Marilyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Marilyn hopes to gain more income from farming so that she can purchase additional land for her rice field.

loans.use: To pay for the labor for land preparation and to purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Agé de 73 ans, Monsieur Ibrahima est un éleveur très expérimenté. Il assure également l'agent de sécurité de l'école primaire de son village. Ces derniers, nous confie-t-il, il a simplifié son travail vu son âge avancé. Il fait un peu d'élevage en achétant pour revendre afin de ganer un peu de bénéfice comme ça avec son revenu qu'il tire de l'école, il pourra subvenir à ses besoins pas trop important pour lui.
texts.en: At the age of 73, Monsieur Ibrahima is a very experienced livestock raiser. He also acts as the security guard for the primary school in his village. This, he confides, has simplified his work, in view of his advanced age. He tends a few animals, buying for resale in order to make a little profit. In that way, with the salary he draws from the school, he will be able to support himself as he doesn't need much.

loans.use: to buy sheep or goats.

loans.name: Mashura

texts.ru:
Машура очень аккуратная и трудолюбивая девушка.  Она занимается купля продажей женской одежды и около 4 лет она в этом бизнесе. Машура хотела после окончание школы поступит в ВУЗ, но ей этого не удалось.  У нее не было возможность и достаточного капитала, чтобы поступать в ВУЗ, поэтому она начала заниматься в этом бизнесе. В дальнейшем её мечта поступить в ВУЗ и стать образованным человеком.  Машура хотела бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента женской одежды с целью расширения бизнеса и получения прибыли. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mashura is a very neat and industrious girl. She has been working buying and selling women's clothes for about four years. Mashura wanted to go to college, but was unable to.  She did not have enough money to enroll in college, so she started this business. In the future, her dream is to go to college and become an educated person. Mashura would like to receive a loan of $3,000 to buy a greater variety of women's clothing in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. Akil is a butcher; he opened his own store in 2007. He has good experience with all kinds of meat. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Akil decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s walls.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is a 34 year-old married father of two children ages three and six years-old. Charo is a photographer in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He has been in this business for one year and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. Charo plans to expand his business by buying another camera and more film. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy another camera and more film.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 55 years old and married. His wife works as an assistant accounts clerk for the Masindi town council. He has five children, all attending school. He has his own residential house and a family dream of educating all his children up to university. 

Patrick has a drug shop where he has been in business for twelve years. His hardships in the business are daily price changes, and his dream is to own a pharmacy. The purpose of the loan is to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme agé, marié et père de quatre enfants.Il pratique depuis plusieurs années l'activité de mareyage.Il achéte du poisson sur les quais de peche de sa région et le revend à des usines qui le traitent avant de l'exporter.Cette activité lui assure pendant une bonne période de l'année des revenus consistants pour prendre en charge sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 500000F pour acheter 10 caisses de "Thiof".Son ambition est d'exporter lui meme son produit.
texts.en: The borrower is a mature man, married and the father of four. Since many ears he has been working as a fish trader. He buys fish from the fishing areas in his region and resells them to factories that process it before exporting. This business has brought him steady income allowing him to provide for his family. He is seeking a loan of 500,000 West African francs in order to buy 10 cases of “thiof” [a species of grouper]. His goal is to become an exporter in his own right.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of "thiof," a fish in the species of grouper

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married with one child. Angela is 32 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Angela is in agricultural business, planting vegetables in her backyard like pumpkin, string beans, okra and others. She sells vegetables to earn a living and had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

Angela joined GDMPC in 2007, she is now four years member of the cooperative. Angela future plan in life is to have a good shelter. She plan to save portion of her income for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Idrissa.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 12 and 6 years. He has 1 additional dependent who live with him because he is the child of his brother, who lives in the village.  

In 1997, Idrissa established his used clothing business. He began this business by selling used clothes from his uncle.  It attracts a lot of women because of the type of used clothing he sells.   Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. 

Idrissa would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid 3 previous loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional bales of used clothes.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. 

In the future, Idrissa plans to have another stall in the market, and support his children’s education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es: La señora Bárbara se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercado de la localidad de Sacaba, se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años y es la actividad con que se sustenta ya que es única fuente de ingresos, la Sra. Bárbara cuenta con casa propia en la zona de Villa Obrajes, tiene 3 hijos que ya son independientes ya casados ella se siente orgullosa ya que sus hijos son personas de bien, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras y papa por mayor,  ella es una persona muy trabajadora y amable se siente agradecida por la confianza brindada en su persona par la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Bárbara sells vegetables in a market in Sacaba; she’s been in this line of work for several years and it’s what supports her since it’s her only source of income.  Bárbara owns her house located in the Villa Obrajes zone.  She has three children who are independent and married now.  She feels proud that her children are upstanding citizens.  She will use money from the loan to buy vegetables and potatoes at wholesale.  She is a very hardworking, kind person who feels grateful for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 14 years, Hawa has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Hawa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids, and will help Hawa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Hawa hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Hawa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hawa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de León, La señora Dora Luz, se dedica arduamente a la labor como maestra de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 10 años, es soltera con 2 hijos que tiene que mantener y por cierto tiene metas para con ellos.

Ceprodel está comprometido con el bienestar de los maestros de manera que estos tengan excelentes condiciones de vivienda y por este motivo, la  señora  Dora requiere hoy en día mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado afectada, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, bloques, hierro, cemento, puerta, arena y pago de mano de obra para realizar las mejora en la casa en lo que es el sector de la cocina, para mayor seguridad de su vivienda. 

Es menester mencionar que por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora Luz, who lives in Quezalguaque town -León departament, works hard as an Elementary School teacher at a small school in town. She has been teaching for the last 10 years. She is the single mother of two children, for whom she has goals. 

CEPRODEL is dedicated to the well being of teachers by manner of making sure they have excellent living conditions. Dora needs to improve her housing conditions, as it is in bad shape. Therefore, she decided to turn to our institution and request a loan to purchase building materials such as blocks, iron, concrete, door, sand and labor, all which will help her improve her kitchen, thus having a safer house. 

It must be noted that this will also mean a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as blocks, iron, concrete, door, sand and labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has two children aged 15 and 10. She has no additional dependents living with her. Her husband is an air conditioner mechanic. 

 In 2003, Kadiatu established her drinks and building material business. She began her business after she obtained her first diploma in Business Admin but could not secure a job. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her profit during the festive period. In the future, Kadiatu plans to continue her education to Degree level and to educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is aged 47. She has six children, all of whom go to school. Her husband works as a teacher. She sells beer and has spent 18 years in the same business. She is very determined to use the loan to improve and increase her inventory of selling beer. Catherine plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children. She would like to own her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for resale.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 30 years old. She is a mother of four children; 2 attend school. 
This new loan will be used to help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize crop while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will help the entire farmers to have a secure store of their crop in the future. UOB’s farmers clients are benefiting from the production financing which is increasing significantly their yield or production. However, during the post-harvest process many are suffering financially as they have to wait for the buyers to pay them. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to construct a warehouse.

loans.name: Nyankonda Thuyikambe W.group

texts.en:
Masulenge lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and is a hardworking woman dealing in the buying and selling of fresh food. She also grows cocoa for supplementary income. She got involved in the businesses to earn income and meet increasing family demands. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business. Masulenge has asked for a loan to buy more fresh foods like beans, tomatoes, cabbages, carrots and onions for resale to her customers.

She is a member of  Nyankonda Thuyikambe W.Group, where members guarantee one another for a loan.

loans.use: To buy more fresh foods to sell to customers of her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO increase capital

loans.name: Shikhali

texts.en:
Shikhali breeds calves and  cows in a private farm shed.
He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had his business for 10 years and it allows him to support his family.
He needs a loan of $1000 to open a butcher shop. He has a lot of customers because his meat is always fresh and delicious. He cleans and feeds the calves and cows himself.
This single man lives in Khaladj village,
Salyan region.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop

loans.name: Ofu

texts.en: She is a lady of thirty-two years of age, with six children.  She used to have great difficulty in meeting her family's needs, particularly the education of her children. When she joined the SPBD microfinance program, she decided to start a small  retail store and used a portion of her loan to expand her husband's taro farm.  Her little investment proved to be successful. She was  able to gradually expand her retail store and her husband's farm was also able to earn additional income, which they used to build a separate shed for her retail shop. She is now very excited to get another loan  to expand the inventory of her retail shop. With the two growing businesses she hopes that she will be able to set aside enough savings for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her retail store

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa R. D. V. is 52 years old, married with four children. Her husband, Severanio V., works 15 hours a day as a bus driver. On his bus route, he passes by Ninfa's business several times a day. The children stay at home in the care of Ninfa's sister. While the couple is at work, the children work on the primary school curriculum. Ninfa and Severiano want their children to keep studying and have a good future.

Ninfa runs a small cafe where she serves soft drinks and typical Paraguayan food, such as breaded cutlets, empanadas, croquettes, and sandwiches. Business is good; the cafe is in a busy commercial area, and people who work there are her main clients.

Ninfa has an excellent credit record and has paid back previous business loans. Business is better than ever and now Ninfa wants to invest further in her cafe, making various improvements and enlarging the dining area. She is asking for $600, which she plans to repay over 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

Ninfa R. D. V. tiene 52 años, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos; su marido se llama Severiano V., el trabaja 15 horas al día como chofer D. autobus y durante su recorrido pasa varias veces por su negocio . Sus hijos quedan en la casa a cuidado D. la hermana D. Ninfa mientras ellos salen a trabajar, están estudiando y cursan la escuela primaria. Ninfa y Severiano desean que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro y que sigan estudiando. Nifa tiene un pequeño bar en el que sirve principalmente milanesas , empanadas, croquetas, sandwiches, comidas tipicas paraguayas, y gaseosas; ella posee muy buena clientela, pues, en la zona existen varias oficinas y comercios cuyos empleados son sus pricipales clientes. Ninfa posee una exelente referencia comercial pues ha solicitado anteriormente préstamos con los que con mucho ezfuerso fue armando D. a poco su negocio y ha sabido cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago. El negocio va cada vez mejor por lo que Ninfa desea invertir en su local haciendo algunas refacciones para poder ampliar su comedor para lo que necesita un préstamo D. US$600 a los que ella se compromete a devolver en 12 meses.

loans.use: To remodel and enlarge her cafe.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

The Lady. Evangelina E. is 26 years old is married to Mr. Milciades Vázquez that is 29 years old.  They are parents of two children smaller than not yet they are at schooling age. They live in very populated district on called Luque Gorge San Rafael, where they have has a store for 2 years. 


They sell meat, rice, panificados, milky, drinks, grass, etc. and she thus provides all the neighbors to them with the district. She and their husband from their beginnings have been clients of the Paraguayan Foundation obtaining loans for the purchase of bookcases and of the different merchandises that sell in their store; in that way they were growing and extending the business. In addition her husband counts on a stable work in a sugar factory making a wage that helps to deal with the expenses of the house. He asks for the loan to buy more merchandises like tinned products, flour, oil, milk, vegetables, etc.


ORIGINAL SPANISH
La Señora. Evangelina E. tiene 26 años está casada con el señor Milciades Vázquez quien 
tiene 29 años, ellos son padres de dos  hijos menores que aún no están en edad escolar.  Viven en barrio muy populoso de Luque llamado Cañada San Rafael, donde tiene montado su despensa desde hace 2 años. 
Ellos venden carne, arroz, panificados, lácteos, bebidas, yerba, etc. y les provee así a todos los vecinos del barrio. Ella y su marido desde sus inicios han sido clientes de la Fundación Paraguaya obteniendo créditos para la compra de estanterías y de las diferentes mercaderías que venden en su despensa; de esa forma fueron creciendo y ampliando el negocio.
Además su marido cuenta con un trabajo estable en una azucarera percibiendo un salario que ayuda a enfrentar los gastos de la casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar más mercaderías como productos enlatados, harina, aceite, leche, verduras, etc.

loans.use: para comprar más mercaderías como productos enlatados, harina, aceite, leche, verduras, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is 27 years old. She is young, enthusiastic, with a fighting spirit and big plans for the future. Since she was very young, she has always been very hard-working, talented, and energetic. Thanks to these qualities, she was able to learn different trades which she performs easily. After doing a variety of jobs, she was able to earn enough to be able to buy her own sewing machine with which she makes jogging suits, polo shirts, T-shirts, etc. This work satisfies her greatly, and it also allows her to cover personal expenditures and economically support her aging parents. She makes the clothes out of a small workshop located in her home daily from 6am to 5pm with the help of two other people, working hard everyday. Her greatest desire is to expand her business and eventually export her clothes. Currently, she seeks a $200 loan which will go towards buying more raw material to make her products. Let's work together to make Olga's dreams come true quickly and so that this young, diligent woman continues in her quest to overcome life's hardships.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga tiene 27 años es una joven entusiasta y luchadora con grandes planes en su vida futura, desde muy pequeñita siempre fue muy laboriosa, hábil y ágil, gracias a esas virtudes pudo aprender diversos oficios en el que se desempeña con facilidad; después de dedicarse a diferentes actividades pudo ahorrar lo suficiente y adquirir su máquina de coser, con el que realiza sus trabajos de confección de buzos, poleras, polos, etc. Trabajo que le viene generando mucha satisfacción y con el que puede cubrir sus gastos personales y apoyar económicamente a sus ancianos padres.En este pequeño taller ubicado en su domicilio Olga realiza sus labores diarias desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde junto a otras 2 personas quienes la apoyan en la confección de las prendas de vestir trabajo que desempeñan en equipo arduamente durante todos los días de la semana. El deseo más grande que tiene es crecer mucho más con este negocio, hasta lograr exportar al exterior sus confecciones; actualmente solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que invertirá en comprar más cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos. Colaboremos para que este deseo se haga realidad en poco tiempo y esta joven diligente siga cobijando en su corazón deseos de superación.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making clothes.

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati is 27 years old and is the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She produces some cakes and sells them at the small shop or local market. Her husband, Pepen, is a driver who earns $2 income per day. She requests a loan of $125 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various cakes.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Tưởng, 32 years of age, has been a member of the TYM Fund for 7 years. Her primary business is trading small merchandise, such as candy, liquor, cigarette etc. Anyone visiting her store would not forget her bright smiling face and her determination of pleasing customers. Her husband, 33, is a farming worker at home also helps her a hand of taking care of the business. All the years Mrs. Tưởng with the TYM Fund, she's been always an exemplary member. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to buy more merchandise. Her income is 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva voluteer.


Chị Lê Thị Tưởng năm nay 32 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ được 7 năm. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là chuyên bán buôn, bán lẻ các loại hàng hóa như bánh kẹo, rượu, thuốc lá và một số mặt hàng khác. Ai đã từng đến cửa hàng kinh doanh của chị Tưởng thì không thể quên được chị bán hàng với khuôn mặt rạng rỡ luôn làm vui lòng khách đến vừa lòng khách đi ấy. Chồng chị năm nay 33 tuổi làm nông nghiệp tại nhà và phụ giúp chị trong công việc kinh doanh. Trong những năm tham gia chị Tưởng luôn là thành viên vay vốn và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Lần này chị muốn đề nghị quỹ cho chị vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của mình. Mức thu nhập của chị Tưởng hiện nay là 150USD.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery store

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Seven years ago, Flor de María started selling food to the workers of a furniture factory near her home. Although this business was going well for her, she decided to put in three internet workstations in her home because she was tired of cooking.

Unfortunately, a little while ago, somebody stole the memory of the three computers. She has had to borrow some other memory to keep working because she didn't have enough money to replace them.

This inconvenience hasn't stopped Flor de María; what's more, she plans to expand her business by offering photocopying and phone booth services.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 7 años, Flor de María vende comida a los trabajadores de una fábrica de muebles cercana a su vivienda. Aunque le va bien en este negocio, decidió poner hace 3 meses cabinas de Internet en su casa pues ya estaba cansada de cocinar.

Lamentablemente, hace poco tiempo, le robaron la memoria de tres computadoras; por lo que ahora ha tenido que prestarse algunas para poder continuar trabajando ya que no tiene dinero suficiente para reponerlas.

Este inconveniente no ha detenido a Flor de María, es más piensa ampliar su negocio brindando servicios de fotocopiado y poniendo locutorios.

loans.use: To expand her business by offering photocopying and phone booth services

loans.name: Bradis

texts.es:
Ms. Bradis is 32 and lives with her family in Hialeah. She has been selling cosmetics door-to-door for five years, visiting workplaces, universities, banks, etc. The income she makes from these sales goes towards covering her family's living expenses, including her three children, who are currently in school. Her husband works as a trucker driver for Petronic and has to spend a lot of time traveling outside of Nicaragua. Therefore, her business has brought them enough income to be able to support the family, while her husband's salary covers their basic housing costs. The family lives in good conditions, and Ms. Bradis' business has allowed her to make improvements to their home and further her goal of providing a decent and safe home for her children. At present, the family needs help in order to finish construction on their kitchen. They still need to build the floor and railings, and she is therefore seeking a loan to be able to finish off the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Bradis tiene 32 años, habita con su familia en Hialeah, lleva 5 años de dedicarse a vender cosméticos de manera ambulante, visita centros de trabajo, universidades, bancos entre otros, con esta actividad apoya en los gastos familiares y de sus 3 hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando, su esposo se desempeña como conductor de pipa de Petronic, el cual permanece mayormente viajando fuera de Nicaragua. Es por eso que su negocio le ha generado suficientes ingresos para apoyar en la manutención de su familia, los ingresos del señor permite pagar los servicios básicos de la vivienda. Esta familia viven en condiciones estables, el mismo negocio le ha permitido a la señora ir acondicionando su vivienda con el objetivo de brindarles un techo digno y seguro a sus hijos, la necesidad en estos momentos es de terminar de construir la cocina, ya que le falta el piso y las verjas, es por eso que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a cerrar su cocina.

loans.use: Purchase of ceramic, cement, iron and cinder blocks

loans.name: Antonio De Jesus

texts.es:
Antonio is 34 and lives in Laureles Norte along with his wife and two children. He has a metal shop and his wife works selling food. He and his wife have invested in both businesses, and this has allowed them to provide food and education for their children. They are a young couple but are hard-working and responsible. Antonio is seeking a loan to purchase materials for his shop. He currently has a good clientele, achieved thanks to the high quality of his workmanship.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Antonio, un hombre joven de 34 años de edad vive en Laureles Norte junto a su esposa y dos hijos. Tiene un taller de soldadura y su esposa le apoya con una venta de comida, junto a su esposa han invertido en el negocio de ambos y a sus hijos le han garantizado su alimento y educación, son una pareja joven pero responsable y trabajadora. Solicita crédito para comprar materiales de soldadura, su taller cuenta con una buena clientela que ha conseguido con la calidad de su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for his welding shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
A pharmacist by profession as well as a wife and mother of 2 young kids, Elena is a very hard working woman who owns 2 businesses: a small pharmacy which she has had for 3 years, and a bookshop which she opened barely 2 years ago. Moreover, each morning she works in a state owned medical centre, dealing with women's concerns, a service that she also offers in her pharmacy and home. However, her goal is to finish building their house so that she can open a general hospital for her community; but in order to do this she needs to finish building her house.

She got this idea as there are not many medical services near where she lives, and she also has support from her family as some of them are specialists in different fields of medicine, like nutrition, general medicine etc. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her husband, who works as an electrician, her dream is not too far from being achieved. She is sure that very soon she will be able to start building the general hospital.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Obstetra de profesión, esposa y madre de dos pequeños niños. Elena es una mujer trabajadora que se encarga de manejar dos negocios a la vez, una botica que tiene tres años y una librería con apenas dos años de formada. Además, durante las mañanas trabaja en un centro médico del estado ofreciendo consultas a mujeres, servicio que también lo brinda en su consultorio de la botica y a domicilio. No obstante, su meta es terminar de construir su casa con la idea de abrir un policlínico para su comunidad, para ello necesita terminar de construir su casa. Esta idea le nació al ver que no hay muchos servicios de salud por donde vive, por otro lado, tiene el apoyo de algunos familiares quienes también son especialistas en diversas ramas de medicina como nutrición, medicina general, etc.. Gracias a su trabajo constante y al apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista, este sueño no está lejos de concretarse. Ella se siente segura de que no falta mucho para poder empezar a construir su policlínico.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish off their house/Compra de materiales de construccion para culminar los trabajos de la construccion en su casa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to make fireworks.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Sat Y., 54, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province, who sells firewood for US$5 of net income each day. This has been a difficult year for people in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. She has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more wood and increase her inventory. She believes that she has a large enough customer base to expand her business, she simply lacks the capital necessary to meet the demand. She sees this loan as an opportunity to increase her daily income and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica has 3 children. She decided to start her own business because she needed money to help her family cover the household expenses and improve her children’s quality of life. Three years ago, she started selling footwear outside her home. She currently sells her merchandise at the nearby flea markets.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase merchandise because she is running out of footwear and she needs to keep investing in her business. With your help, Verónica will be able to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica tiene 3 hijos, ella decidió iniciar su negocio ya que necesitaba ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia con los gastos de la casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo calzado afuera de su casa y actualmente vende en mercados rodantes cercanos a su domicilio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía ya que la que tenia se le esta acabando y necesita seguir invirtiendo. Con tu ayuda Verónica podrá salir adelante

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Kazija's Mtasi Wa Masi Group

texts.en:
Kazija is 39 years old. She is married and has 4 children who are ages 3 months, 3, 8 and 12 years.

Kazija has a business selling firewood and soap. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Kazija now seeks a loan to buy more firewood and soap for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mgeni and Biubwa.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and soap

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La señora Valentina, vive con su yerna y sus nietos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Élla cubre con todos los gastos D. la familia, debido a que el hijo tuvo que irse a trabajar al interior del país, buscando mejores condiciones D. vida, por ello, es la unica persona que genera  ingresos para la mantención del hogar. Es una cliente muy responsable y cumplida con sus obligaciones, laborales y familiares. Vive en una zona alejada D. la ciudad D. La Paz.. Actualmente solicita el sexto credito en Emprender, teniendo un historial D. credito impecable.
texts.en:
Valentina lives with her mother-in-law and her grandchildren, all of whom are school aged. She covers all of the family's expenses. Given that her son had to emigrate to work outsiD. the country, looking for better living conditions, she is the only person that generates an income for the maintenance of their household. She is a very warm person, very responsible and true to her obligations, work wise and family. She lives in the Alejada region of the city of La Paz. She is currently requesting her sixth loan from Emprender, having an impeccable credit history with them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery story products for sales.

loans.name: Jessica Nakanwagi's Group

texts.en:
Jessica is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 43-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged between 28 and 8. Two of her children go to school. Her first 2 children are married and are not working. She resides in and owns a 3-room house, where she is staying with 3 people and doesn't take care of any other additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets 2 meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Jessica runs a charcoal store at her home in Nakulabye market, near Kampala city. Jessica doesn't incur any extra transport costs because she gets the charcoal from suppliers, who get it from villages. Jessica sells to an average of 15 people a day and works 7 days a week. Jessica sells to all categories of people, and her major monthly expense is medication. Jessica has been with MCDT for 4 years and is servicing her eighth loan. Jessica is aspiring to see her business grow bigger so that she can start selling both retail and wholesale. She wants to boost her business and construct rental shops in the available space.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đại năm nay 35 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1995 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian  chăn nuôi lợn hiệu quả gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt. Hiên tại với sự hỗ trợ thêm của chồng và các con công việc chăn nuôi của gia đìnhchị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3,5 triệu/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12 triệu để đầu tư vốn mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc  chăn nuôi vịt của gia đình
texts.en:
Chị Đại is 35 this year. Her family has three school-aged children. In 1995, she joined the TYM Fund borrowing capital to invest in the business of rearing pigs. After a period of time, as they got good results from the pig rearing business, her family diligently borrowed more funds to raise ducks. Currently, with her husband and children assistance, the family's animal rearing business is growing successfully and provides an income of 3,500,000 VND per month. She hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND during this loan cycle to purchase animal feed for the family's pig and duck rearing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animal feed for family's pig and duck rearing business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.fr: Né vers 1948 dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur  D. Abraham est marié et père de 8 enfants dont 4 scolarisés. Il est un cultivateur dans le village d’Ahovilèkomè de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU DE HOUEDOME. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique ils ont sollicité un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1948 in the Houedome district of Dangbo village, Mr. Abraham D. is married and has eight children, four of whom attend school. He is a farmer in Ahovilèkomè village in the Ouémé valley and he is a member of the Houedome group GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU. The inhabitants of this village farm the land after the level of the Ouémé river drops. Their lands are rich and highly productive. Their main business activities involve growing corn, peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes and manioc. The problem for these river valley dwellers is that, during the flood period, they no longer have anything to do and they spend all the income generated from the sale of their harvested produce. At low water they don’t have any money left to pay the workforce that is essential for sowing the land available to them. The local practice of selling off the harvested crops does not provide them with security, moreover, it bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at a rock-bottom price to an affluent person to get hold of the money required to carry out the farming. Tired of this practice, they have asked for a loan of 100,000 FCFA ($200) to farm about one hectare of the aforementioned land. .

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To farm one hecatre of corn and peppers

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.ru:
Рахматова Тухфа женщина в возрасте 44 лет имеет троих сыновей.Тухфа занимается продажей продуктов питания по районам Гончи и Масчох.Получив займ она хочет увеличить свой ассортимент товара.Ездиет она
два раза в неделю.У неё свои постоянные клиенты,которые ждут её.Тухфа узнав от подруг,что можно получить кредит для расширения бизнеса обратилась к нам.
texts.en:
Tuhfa R. is 44 years and has three sons. She sells groceries in the Ghonchi and Mastchoh districts. She would like to use this loan to increase the assortment of her products. She delivers her orders twice a week and has many loyal clients. Tuhfa found out about this loan program from her friends and decided to obtain this loan to help grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase products assortment

loans.name: Abdul Zohor Group

texts.en:
A. Zohor is the group leader of this group. There are two members in this group, A. Zohor and Aseyla.

A. Zohor wants to take a loan for his business of vegetable shop and he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Aseyla wants to take a loan for her husband's business, also a vegetable shop. Her husband wants to make his business larger.
