They thank all lenders of Kiva in Afghanistan. They want to say that these loans help businesses progress and become larger. They thank the Kiva process in Afghanistan for supporting poor people.

loans.use: To expand his vegetable store.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Es un banco comunal compuesto por 15 personas, todos viven en el Km: 9 a la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Su actividad económica es la venta D. ropa, comida y cosméticos. Y el destino del crédito será para aumentar su capital.
RAQUEL M..- Es la líder del banco, es una mujer con muchas ganas D. superación su actividad principal es la venta D. comida ella esta empezando a trabajar con Emprender su objetivo es seguir trabajando mucho tiempo mas para que D. esta manera poder seguir creciendo económicamente.
FRANCISCA M..- es la secretaria del banco comunal, se dedica a la venta D.  pan vive en casa D. sus padres, su objetivo es contar con su propia panadería, para D. esta manera  poder ayudar su familia y también seguir estudiando.
FREDDY S. C..-  El sr. Freddy es el tesorero del banco comunal, vive en casa familiar en el Barrio 23 D. diciembre del km. 9.
D. igual  manera que los mencionados anteriormente, se dedican a la actividad D. panadería, en la cual trabaja junto a toda su familia.
Es un cliente que tiene muchas ganas trabajar, su fin u objetivo con el préstamo que le fue otorgado es agrandar mucho mas su capital D. trabajo,
texts.en:
The community bank is maD. up of 15 people who all live in the Km:9 zone of the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. They work selling clothing, food and cosmetics. The loan will be used to increase their capital. Raquel M. is the leader of the bank, and is a woman who really wants to build a better life. Her main economic activity is selling food. She is just starting to work with the Emprender organization. Her objective is to continue working for a long time to come, and in this way continue growing her income. Francisca M. is the secretary of the community bank, and works selling bread. She lives in her parents' home, and her goal is to own her own bakery so that she can help her family and also continue to study. Freddy S. C. is the treasurer of the community bank. He lives in his family home in the 23 D. Diciembre neighborhood of Km:9. Similar to those mentioned above, he works in the bakery business, together with the rest of his family. He is very keen to work, and his objective with this loan is to build up more working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa S. is a 44 year old mother of five.  She wants to use some of her loan to buy a pig to raise.  She hopes that in the future, she can save money to send all of her children to a university.

Her five year membership in ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) has impacted her life and her family. Her income from her previous loans was used to finance the education of her children; two in elementary, two in secondary and one in college.  She applied for this loan to buy a brand new rickshaw and some spare parts for the maintenance of her older rickshaw, handled by her son Walter.  

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and a carpenter.  Her husband and son, Walter, are very supportive of her business.

loans.use: Buy a pig, new rickshaw and rickshaw parts.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Ước Group
loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina was born in 1983. She is married and the mother of one child. She is a very interesting person who is always in contact with people. That comes from her positive spirit and her occupation. Sabina was in secondary music school and she sings at weddings. She also works as a make-up artist at home. She want to improve the services in her "salon" and is requesting a loan of 1200 Bosnian convertible marks (or about $850 US) from WWI. She will use this loan to buy a machine for wax smelting and some other materials and equipment.

loans.use: To buy a wax smelting machine

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Jocelyn C. has been a member since August 17, 2004, and is a bonafide resident of Trucat Boundary, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. At 34 years old, she is married and blessed with 3 children. Recently, she's requesting her 6th loan in the amount of 4,000 php that will be used as additional capital for her banana vending. She's thankful to Paglaum Coop for allowing her to borrow money that will be used for additional capital for said project.

loans.use: additional capital for her banana vending

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana Amoako, 43, is married with five children: two daughters and three sons. A couple of her children are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Susana trades in stationery materials and owns a shop at the lorry station. She sells all kinds of books and other logistics such as pen, pencil, chalk, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in the business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Susana aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy stationery in bulk

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy T., age 45, of San Mateo, Rizal, Philippines, is the mother of two grade-school-aged girls and the wife of a businessman.

Mercy runs an apparel-sewing business that caters mostly to schools and offices in Metro Manila. For seven years, her shop has produced custom-made clothes, school and office uniforms, tote bags, and caps. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional cloth and other sewing materials.

During lean months (January to March and July to August), Mercy accepts sub-contract sewing jobs from bigger companies to be able to pay for the salary of her six seamstresses and to pay for other expenses. The business now earns an average net income of 25,000 PHP per month.

In the near future, Mercy plans to create her own line of t-shirts, bags, and caps with Christian themes, and to acquire a store space in a mall where she prefers to market her products.

loans.use: Cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Maria D. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tienda en la cual vende utencilios de plastico como ser baldes, pailas, vasos, etc. tambien vende sandalias y chancletas, cepillos para baño y fajas de cuero para caballeros. este negocio le a dado muy buenos resultados, ya que comenzo su  negocio vendiendo en su carrito y ahora tiene 3 puestos ubicados en diferentes puntos  comerciales del municipio de trojes. Don Chema se caracteriza por los  precios comodos que brinda a sus clientes y por la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes.
tambien sale a vender en su carrito a diferentes aldeas y caserios de la localidad lo que le genera ingresos permanentes, como dice el dicho si la montaña no biene ha Maoma, Maoma va a la montaña entoces don Chemita va donde ellos. Este credito lo va a invertir para surtir mas su negocio donde tenga de todo un poco de tal manera no dejar al cliente irse sin comprar nada.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Maria D. works in retail and has a small store. He sells plastic goods such as buckets, pans and cups, etc. He also sells sandals and flip flops, toilet brushes and men’s leather belts. This business has been profitable for him. He began his business selling from his cart and now he has 3 stalls located in different commercial locations in the town of Trojes. Mr. Chema is known for the comfortable prices he offers his customers and for his friendliness when dealing with his customers. He also goes out and sells with his cart to different villages and country houses in the area. This generates a permanent income. Like the saying says, if the mountain doesn’t come to Mohammad, Mohammad goes to the mountain. So Mr. Chemita goes where they are. He is going to use this loan to stock up his business so that he has a little of everything. This way he won’t let the customer leave without buying something.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase plastic goods, sandals, flip flops, brushes, leather belts

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L. (10100006958) is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the town of Apia.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Maria plants, harvests, and sells fruits & vegetables.  Maria has just started this business and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD to purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Maria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha is a member of the Nyamwenda 2 borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 14,10,7 and 3 years.

Jenipha started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jenipha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale .

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Jenipha hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Horlinda

texts.es:
Horlinda tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, vive en su casa propia donde acoge a la familia de sus dos hijos, con quienes comparte momentos agradables junto a sus nietos. Durante todo el día vende deliciosos dulces y golosinas en la puerta de su domicilio, donde instaló un pequeño puesto y donde espera con mucha alegría a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son niños y escolares de su localidad. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es la sonrisa de los niños, quienes la contagian con su buen sentido del humor, ella lleva 27 años vendiendo en su casa y considera que lo difícil es atender su puesto con sus nietos alado, pues no desea que sus pequeños consuman demasiados dulces que perjudiquen su salud. Para el futuro, Horlinda espera ampliar su negocio y tener un local donde pueda vender frutas y bebidas, productos que son muy consumidos en el verano.
Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que su puntualidad es una de las garantías que la respaldan. Con los tres mil soles solicitados implementará su puesto con nuevos productos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Loa

texts.en: Loa S., 25, is married and has a three-year-old child. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured). To make a living, she is currently employed in a local garment factory, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is employed in a private company, earning approximately an income of US $7 in revenue per day, which they use to cover their household expenses. This primary source of income helps his family a lot. This couple tries to work hard every day for the sake of their child. S. is seeking to improve her standard of living by starting another business, so she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase animal food for her pigs. By doing so, she hopes that she will be able to generate more income.

loans.use: purchasing pig food

loans.name: Alain Alonso

texts.es:
Alaín tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y cuatro hermanos en el pueblo joven San Martín, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace tres años su madre adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) y se la entregó para que trabajara en ella. Durante todo este tiempo el ha estado trabajando en la mototaxi y con ella ha estado apoyando a su familia, asimismo también se ha pagado sus estudios de mecánica automotriz en un Instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que empiece a sufrir fallas y para repararlas es preciso comprarle nuevas piezas a su motor, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación de su vehículo y en la legalización de los papeles de propiedad y licencias necesarias para ganarse el sustento de forma segura.

Alaín desea seguir estudiando para asegurarse su futuro y seguir apoyando a su familia. El es un joven muy querido y estimado por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive.
texts.en:
Alaín is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents and four brothers in the town of San Matrín, located in the city of Lambayeque, 15 minutes from Chiclayo city.

Three years ago his mother bought a mototaxi (a motorized taxi vehicle used for transporting cargo and passengers) and gave it to him so he could use it to work. During this time he has been working with the mototaxi and with it has been able to support his family, as well as pay his auto mechanic studies in Chiclayo Institute.

The continuous use of his mobile unit has caused malfunctions and to repair it he needs to buy new parts for the engine. This is the reason he needs to request Edpyme Alternativa 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to repair his vehicle, to legalize his documents of ownership, and the necessary licenses to earn his living securely.

Alaín wishes to continue studying to secure his future and continue to support his family. He is a well-loved young man and appreciated by his neighbors in the area he lives in.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his vehicle's engine.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
la sra. Adriana Z. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio de venta de refrescos, agua, jugos etc. Adriana Vive en la aldea de Lajero blanco carretera a Cedeño, este lugar es muy caliente, ya que cedeño es una playa de la costa del pacifico de Honduras.
este tipo de producto se vende mucho aqui en esta localidad ya que hace mucha calor en todo el dia y las personas buscan tomar algo helado y refrescante para calmar la sed. 
Adriana busca comprar mas mercaderia ya que tiene una refrigeradora vacia y necesita llenarla de prodcuto para tenerlo bien helado y asi mejorar sus ventas, ademas que los carros que reparten los refrescos llegan una vez por semana y su producto se le termina muy rapido y para comprar mas tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Çholuteca es por tal razon que ella necesita el credito.
texts.en:
Adriana Z. is a merchant. She sells soft-drinks, water, juices, etc. Adriana lives in the Lajero Blanco village, located along the Cedeño highway. The climate here is very hot since Cedeño is a beach on Honduras' pacific coast. This type of product sells well due to the daily heat and folks look to drink something cold and refreshing to quench their thirst. Adriana seeks to buy more merchandise since she has an empty refrigerator and she needs to fill it with product to have nice and cold and improve her sales. Also, the soft-drink distribution trucks only come by once a week and they run out of product quickly so, if she wants to buy more stock, she has to go to the city of Çholuteca. This is why she needs this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, juices, bottled water, bagged juices, vegetable juices.

loans.name: Kesia

texts.en:
Kesia L. is a woman living in the town of Sataua Uta. She is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Kesia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Kesia has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Kesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kesia is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Kesia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sharavdorj

texts.en:
S. Sharavdorj is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His girls, ages 12 and 6, both attend secondary school and his wife is the director at the local tax office. Sharavdorj manages a raw materials trading business in his town. He collects raw materials, such as animal skins and products, from the countryside and transports them to Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia, to sell. Sharavdorj has been in business for 12 years now and has built a consistent operation over the years. He is focused on growing his business and hopes to expand in the near future. He says, “I am working hard to improve my business.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials to sell in his business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to sell

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda P., 56 years old, is a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Her parents taught her everything she knows about planting corn and maintaining a good and quality harvest. Her farm is earning very well but she admitted that she still needs additional capital to grow her business.

Lutgarda joined the loan program of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008. She likes the program very much and that is why she is still a member of the CEVI cluster association.

Lutgarda would like to apply for another loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs and supplies. In this way, she believes she will be able to obtain a greater harvest and more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and supplies

loans.name: Twegatte Association, Jinja Group

texts.en:
I. Paul is 28 years old and the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man with three children aged 6, 4, and 2 years and he helps to care for his sister who is in school.

Paul is a businessman dealing in the sale of clothes, maize, beans and coffee from Namulesa; for eight years he has been dealing in all these businesses. The main challenge that he faces, especially with his clothes business, is that some customers take the goods on credit and fail to pay, hence having a bad effect on his cash flow.

On average, Paul makes 90,000/= as weekly profits and one of his strong points is that he is a hardworking man with a strong drive to invest more in his businesses. He needs a loan to help him restock all his businesses with more goods and produce.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce to sell and more new clothes for his shop

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es: Blanca  Mirian   C.  M. de 57 años de edad, reside en Lourdes colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es jubilado, y quien le ayuda a ella con el negocio. Blanca posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas. El negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar en el cual las personas llegan a comprar las tortillas, las cuales las prefieren, debido a que blanca cuenta con 8 años de experiencia. Así mismo ella se encarga de llevar tortillas a los trabajadores de una fábrica que está ubicada cerca de su casa, labor en la cual su esposo le ayuda cargando las tortillas hasta la fábrica. Por esta razón Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayores cantidades de maíz, cal, y gas propano, para la elaboración y cocción de las tortillas, esto le será de mucho beneficio para ella debido a que le permitirá hacer mayor cantidad d producto y así podrá atender mayor cantidad de pedidos. Blanca es una persona muy trabajadora a quien le llena de mucha ilusión el poder atender más clientes y aceptar más pedidos, lo cual se convierte en mayores ganancias para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Blanca Mirian C. M. is 57 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, in the La Libertad zone. She lives with her husband, who is retired and helps her with the business. The business is located in their home, where people go to buy their favorite tortillas (as Blanca has 8 years of experience). She is also in charge of delivering tortillas to the workers at a factory that is located close to her home, and her husband helps her by carrying the tortillas to the factory. Blanca is asking for a loan to obtain the money needed to buy greater quantities of corn, lime, and propane gas for making tortillas. This would be of great benefit to her since it would let her make a greater quantity of her product and be able to fill more orders. Blanca is a very hard-working person who is full of hope because she will be able to attend to more customers and accept more orders, which will result in higher earnings for herself and for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, and propane gas

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a curtain and dress making business. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital to her curtain and dress making business. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional curtain and clothing materials. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pruchase additional clothing materials.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Dembagnouma  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dibida, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe Dembagnouma qui se sont connus à travers des liens de voisinage, font essentiellement l’achat et la vente des articles divers tels les habits les cosmétiques et des  grains de céréales.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq prêts précédents, elles  sont à leur  sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de grains de céréales sèches (fonio, petit mil, maïs, haricot) estimée à 19 sacs de 100 kg. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement auprès des producteurs du village et environs et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana, à domicile,  généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et de revendeurs venant des grandes ville telles  Bamako, Ségou et Koulikoro.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  22.500FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Dembagnouma are all married. On average, they are 37 years old, with four children each and they live in traditional extended families in Dibida, one of the towns of Fana, a county of Dioila, the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. The women of the group Dembagnouma know one another through neighborhood connections. Their business is essentially re-selling various items, such as clothing, cosmetics and cereals/ grains. Having fully repaid their five previous loands, they are requesting their sixth loan, with they will use to purchase a large quantity of dried cereals (fonio (a millet-like grain), small millet, corn and beans) - approximately nineteen 100 kilograms sacks. They mostly supply themselves from farmers in and around their own town. They sell their goods in the market of Fana and from their homes, generally for cash, to a clientele composed of women, men and re-sellers in the large towns of Bamako, Ségou and Koulikoro. They envision each earning an average monthly income of 22,500FCFA, which they will use to pay for the needs of their families and invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Darlin Maria

texts.es: Darlin tiene 28 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Desde hace mas de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida vendiendo refrescos, Darlin no tuvo la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios, por lo que tenía que ayudar a su Mama a vender es por eso que lucha todos los días para darle esa oportunidad a sus hijos, a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en materia prima pues así comprara azúcar, bolsas, pajillas y las frutas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Darlin is 28 years old and the mother of 3 children who are minors and in her care. She has been in the business of selling soft drinks for over 12 years and started with her own efforts, since her mother taught her how to make a living selling soft drinks.

Darlin didn't have a chance to finish school, since she had to help her mother to sell soft drinks. This is why she struggles every day to give that opportunity to her children, despite the difficult situations she has faced, she remains in this activity.

She will invest the money as working capital to buy sugar, bags, straws and fruit. She dreams with improving her house since it doesn’t have the basic services.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet G. is from the village of Bolao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Juliet is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling children's clothing, DVD players, and food for the children such as biscuits in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bolao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro Chavarría Gonzales  es un señor de 57 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa  y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde muy joven don Pedro se ha dedicado a la ganadería, de esta forma ha mantenido a su familia. Comenta que tiene ya 40 años de estar en este proyecto por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda y la instrucción adecuada. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso ya que ha visto como poco a poco ha salido adelante.  

Don Pedro desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢666,000 (seiscientos sesenta y seis  mil colones) para comprar más terneros y poder hacer crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante ya que ellos representan la motivación para esforzarse cada día y trabajar con esmero.

Don Pedro  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal EMCRECOBA, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y asegura que estos le han ayudado muchísimo para llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Pedro Chavarría Gonzales, 57, lives with his wife and two children in a community called Caño Negro located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is notable for being a mountainous area very close to the country’s northern border. Its main economic activities are farming, specifically basic grains, sugar cane and oranges, and cattle-raising. Pedro has raised cattle since he was very young; this is how he has supported his family. He tells us that he’s been in this line of work for 40 years so he has experienced all the cares it demands as well as adequate training. He says that he’s very proud because he has gradually gotten ahead in life. Pedro wants a 666,000 colones loan to buy young calves to raise so that his business will succeed; he wants to be a successful micro entrepreneur to help his family get ahead because they are his motivation to continue his daily efforts to work hard. Pedro is a member of EMCRECOBA communal bank, one EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his 3rd loan and he assures us that loans have been of great use to him in reaching his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six calves.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden B. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to import more chickens and bags of cassava flour from Uganda.

Kiden is 41 years old and is married to a watchman. She has five children, two of whom go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Kiden hopes to be able to extend the floor of her hotel (restaurant).

loans.use: To import more chickens and bags of cassava flour from Uganda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: Mrs. Yet Ouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yet O. has been selected as village bank loan group leader by fourteen people who are located in Srae Pou village in Takeo province. All the members make up a village bank loan, and they will each use a small part of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yet O. was born in 1972. She is a silk cloth seller at her local market. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Yet O. is seeking a loan to buy more silk cloth for resale. Her husband, Mr. Phong Choub, is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family and he is a cow middleman, too. 

Mrs. Yet O.  is the mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk cloth for resale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario G. M. es de la ciudad de  Santani, con casa propia, soltero, tiene 36 años de edad.
 
           Es propietario de una gomeria con 11 años de funcionamiento, tambien vende cubiertas nuevas y usadas, esta muy bien ubicado, al costado de la ruta 3.

               Es su tercera operación de creditos con esta institución, canceló en forma excelente sus creditos anteriores, y solicita nuevamente el credito para la compra de cubiertas e infladores.
texts.en:
Señor Mario G. M. lives in the city of Santani in his own house. He is single and 36 years of age. He is the owner of a tire store with 11 years of experience. He also sells used and new wheel covers. His business is in a good location, next to route 3. This is his third loan with this institution, having repaid his previous loans in excellent fashion. He again requests a loan for the purchase of wheel covers and pumps.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheel covers and pumps for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene 24 años, es soltero, vive solo en compañía de sus padres. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El cuidar adecuadamente sus chacras es su principal función, desde hace 12 años disfruta ver como se desarrollan las plantaciones de plátanos, café, frutas cítricas, entre otros productos oriundos de esta zona, aunque le es difícil tener que limpiarlos, pues no le gusta machetear ni retirar las malezas, ya que estando a diario con esta actividad sus brazos le llegan a doler. Por  eso prefiere plantar y cosechar, además Juan pone en practica las técnicas agrícolas que le enseño su padre. En adelante continuara con esta actividad, puesto que el café y plátano son productos muy solicitados en el mercado, además desea construir su propia casa, y en ella instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y desde un principio trabaja de manera activa en su grupo comunal, junto a sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará decenas de plantas de café y varios sacos de abono para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a home that they own. His primary job is to provide adequate care to his fields. For the past ten years, he has enjoyed developing his crops of bananas, coffee, citrus fruits, and other products that are native to the area. Clearing his fields is difficult work, which explains why he does not like removing brush and pulling weeds. Doing this type of work every day makes his arms sore. Juan prefers to plant and harvest, as well as utilize the farming techniques that his father taught him. Later on he hopes to continue growing coffee and bananas since these products are in high demand at the market. In addition, he wants to build his own house and establish a business selling groceries.

This is the second time he has received a loan from MFP. From the start, Juan has worked as an active member of his Communal Bank with the other members. The loan he requested will be used to buy dozens of coffee plants and several sacks of compost for fertilizing his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & sacks of compost

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es: Sergio Alberto de 64 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Sergio se dedica a la venta de madera, la venta está ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido, ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre apreciar los productos de él. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que Sergio solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando mayor variedad de maderas para la elaboración de sus productos, todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y así contar con una vida mejor para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio Alberto is 64 years old. He has five children, and they all work independently. Sergio sells wood, and this business is located at his house. The location is very good for sales because it is in a very busy place. He has many customers who always value his products. The business is very stable. Serio is requesting a loan because he wants to be able to increase his inventory. He will buy a greater variety of wood in order to make his products. All of this is because he wants to improve his sales. That way he and his family will have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona A. is from the town of Roxas Cordon Isabela. She is 29 years –old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jona owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jona has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jona joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Jona is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jona from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: ManZ. B. est  trésorière du groupe Baraka Alanine, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants, son mari est vendeur de bassin plastic au marché sectoriel de Kibabi-Birere. Son fils ainé est 2e primaire et le second fait l’école maternelle. Juste l’après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo, qui aurait complètement détruit la ville de Goma en 2002, elle  commença son business avec son fond propre par la vente des  divers objets ménagers notamment des assiettes, casseroles, fourchettes, etc. plus tard, elle bénéficia du crédit de  Hekima en 2006 pour renforcer son business de commerce. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché sectoriel Alanine. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner  certaines marchandises notamment les pantalons uniformes bleus pour les écouler à la rentrée scolaire d’ici début septembre 2010. Elle souhaiterait  construire une maison un peu spacieuse et faire scolariser ses enfants confortablement. En plus, elle ambitionne avoir une chambre boutique pour ses marchandises. La cliente ManZ. B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Baraka Alanine est composé de 21 membres, majoritairement femmes dont un homme , monsieur Jules L. n’a pas été présent lors de prise de photo du groupe. Cet homme est le président du marché sectoriel Alanine.
texts.en:
ManZ. B. is the treasurer of the group, Baraka Alanine. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a plastic basin salesman at the Kibabi-Birere sectoral market. Her eldest son is in his second year of primary school and her second is in nursery school. Just after the eruption of the Nyiragongo Volcano, which would have completely destroyed the city of Goma in 2002, she her business with her own funds gotten through the sale of various household items, notably plates, saucepans, forks, etc. Later, she benefited from a loan from Hekima in 2006, to strengthen her shop. She displays her merchandise in the sectoral market of Alanine. This new loan will serve to restock certain merchandise, notably the blue uniform pants for students at the beginning of the school year here in the beginning of September 2010. She wishes to build a more spacious house and to comfortably fund her children's schooling. She also aspires to have a boutique room for her merchandise. The client ManZ. B. thanks Hekima for its actions to aid poor citizens excluded from classical banks. It may be noted that the group Baraka Alanine is made up of 21 members, mostly women and one man, Mr. Jules L., who was not present at the time the group photo was taken. This man is the president of the sectoral market of Alanine.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blue uniform pants

loans.name: Ejartu

texts.en: Ejartu is married and has one child who is 15 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her because she wants to help educate them.  In 1993, Ejartu established her used clothing business. She began her business to help her husband support their family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,425,700 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Ejartu requires a loan in order to add stock to her business.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. She intends to use the proceeds from this to educate her children to the university level.  In the future, Ejartu plans to rent a shop and travel to her neighboring country in order to buy large quantities of used clothing.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Nahim Dante

texts.es: El señor Nahim tiene como principal actividad económica la venta de ajuares y ropa de bebe, los ajuares los elabora el mismo en su taller que queda en la ciudad de Viacha, el mismo vende sus productos en la Huyustus y en la Tumusla  ( zonas comerciales de la ciudad de La Paz )don Nahim vive junto a su madre y a su pequeño hermano, este negocio lo aprendió de su padre, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tela polar y en ropa de bebé, en un futuro el piensa en hacer crecer su negocio y a corto plazo tener una verdadera fábrica de costura. Por el momento el quiere comercializar su producto en el mercado chileno gracias a un contacto que tiene en este país.Don Nahim sueña con dar a su hermnito y a su mama un futuro mejor y estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nahim sells trousseaux and baby clothes.  He makes the trousseaux himself in his workshop in the city of Viacha, and he sells his products in la Huyustus and la Tumusla, which are commercial areas of La Paz.  Nahim lives with his mother and his little brother.  He learned this trade from his father.  

He will invest the loan in buying fleece and baby clothes.  In the future, he hopes to increase his business and have an actual sewing factory.  He wants to sell his product in the Chilean market through a contact he has there.  Nahim hopes to give his baby brother and his mother a better future and more economic stability.

loans.use: To buy fleece and baby clothes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is 26 years old, married to Martin Simiyu and they have a son who is called Kevin. He is four years old. He is in a baby class. They live in the Lugulu area in the outskirts of Kakamega town.

Caroline does a salon business where she also has a display on one side where she sells new shoes as well and she is applying for her first loan as she is in dire need of hair chemicals and rollers for the salon business. She has been running the salon for the past two years and her monthly income is Kshs 6,000. 

She hopes to open up a boutique to run alongside the salon to enable her to make extra profits.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and rollers to add to her stock

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 35-year-old single mother of three who lives with her grandfather, three nephews and her children in Esparza, Puntarenas, located near the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica. Sonia faces extraordinary challenges in her personal life. Her mother has recently passed away, rendering Sonia the sole care provider for her 96-year-old grandfather and three sons (her nephews are adults). 

Sonia was referred to Fundación Mujer by a long-standing client who has worked with Sonia over the past five years. Sonia´s goal for the current loan is to increase her working capital and make investments that will lead to increased revenue during the Christmas shopping season. 

Sonia has a business selling various products such as eggs, chickens, and clothing. Prior to the death of her mother, Sonia had the objective of offering a more diverse range of products to her clients. She hopes to use this loan to satisfy this objective by investing in a variety of clothes for men, women and children. Sonia plans to travel to rural areas around Esparza in order to attract new customers. 

Sonia wakes up at 5:30AM, prepares breakfast for her family, and sees the children off to school. She then returns home to bathe and feed her grandfather breakfast. Sonia dedicates the hours after breakfast until lunch to her business; during this time she makes sales, collects payments, or makes inventory purchases. Her main goal is to be able to earn enough from her productive activity to provide an acceptable standard of living for her family, and be able to pay for the education of her children.

Sonia´s main challenge is to manage her domestic and business lives. She has been earning steady revenue over the past five years and is a hard working entrepreneur with a large number of loyal customers. This loan will enable her to manage her difficult situation with more ease.

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Angela Marina

texts.es:
Ángela de 46 años, confecciona y cose ropa en su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Desde pequeña ella aprendió a coser porque su mama le enseño para que tenga una oportunidad de trabajar independientemente. A la edad de 20 años inicio cosiendo y confecciona ropa a sus vecinos y amigos poco a poco pudo comprar su propia máquina de coser y tener ya un numero definido de clientes. En la actualidad tienen su taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 16h30pm de lunes a viernes haciendo ropa por pedido y enmendándola.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina de coser porque la que tiene ya esta vieja. En el futuro quiere que sus cuatro hijos sean profesionales y tener una papelería en su casa.
texts.en:
Ángela is 46 years old.  She makes and sews clothes in her home.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Paraíso de la Flor.  It is located in a region which is characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

She learned to sew when she was a little girl because her mom taught her so that she would have an opportunity to work independently.  At the age of 20, she began sewing and making clothes for her neighbors and friends.  Little by little she was able to buy her own sewing machine and have a clearly defined number of customers.  She currently has her sewing and dressmaking workshop in her home.  She works from 7.30am to 4.30pm from Monday to Friday, making clothes to order and mending them.

She would like to use her loan to buy a sewing machine since the one she has is already old.  In the future, she would like for her four children to be professionals and to have a stationery shop in her home.

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Elimelda

texts.en:
Elimelda is a mother six and has been doing mixed farming in her hometown of Kisii in Western Kenya. She has employed one farmhand and sells her produce of maize, vegetables and milk locally.

She has requested this loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. She plans to use the income to pay school fees. She gets her additional income from her employment as a market attendant at the local market. She is focusing on having three dairy cows in five years.

Price fluctuations and heavy rains and hailstorms are the greatest disappointments.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren M. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His older son attends a local secondary school and his younger is in kindergarten. His wife works in an ice cream making factory as a part-time worker. 

Lhagvasuren owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2005 and has gained a lot of business experience over the years. His earnings have enabled him to improve his old car. For the future, he plans to buy a car for his wife who will also operate a taxi service in her free time to supplement their family income. Lhagvasuren is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car in order to start another taxi service for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a car in order to start another taxi service

loans.name: Lilis 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa D. la señora Laura, una integrante del grupo Lilis 1 que está ubicado en la ciudad D. Orizaba en el estado D. Veracruz en México. Laura se dedica a la venta D. ropa y novedades que inicio hace 4 años,solicita el prestamo para incrementar su negocio metiendo mas variedad,al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente muy contenta y satisfecha. Ella tiene 27 años,estudio hasta la preparatoria,es casada y tiene 2 hijos: un hombre y una mujer. Laura quiere este credito para comprar mercancía,también espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía familiar. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Laura’s house, one of the Lilis I group members, which is located in the city of Orizaba in the state of Veracruz, México.

Laura has sold clothes and novelties for the last 4 years.  She is asking for a loan to expand the business introducing more variety.

At the moment of asking for the loan she feels very happy and satisfied.  She is 27 years old and studied up to high school.  She’s married and has two children, a boy and a girl.

Laura wants the loan to buy merchandise.  She hopes sales will increase and her family economy will improve.  The group has 9 members.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد متزوج في عمر 34 سنة له ولد يعمل في مجال النقل العام له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى دائما
الى تطويره فهو يريد ان يزداد مدخوله المادي له خبرة في عمله فهو له زبائن كثيرة من محيطه وجيرانه وسواح
يقصدونه لتعريفه على المناطق اللبنانية يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع سيارته وتحسين وضع المحرك
حتى يستطيع تطوير عمله يريد لعائلته التطوير والتحسين وزيادة مدخولهم
texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old husband and father of one who wants to increase his family’s income. Ahmad has 15 years of experience operating a taxi around Lebanon for the many neighbors and tourists who make up his clientele. He is always seeking to further develop his work and further increase revenues. Accordingly, he wanted to ask for a loan from A. Majmoua to have some maintenance work performed on his car and his car engine in particular.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Norbeto

texts.en:
Norbeto T. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2007. He is a resident of Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City. Norberto is 58 years old, married and has three adult children. He sells fresh eggs in the local community, whereby he earns approximately $115 monthly. 

Norberto is happy that he was able to borrow money from Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative because it helped make his egg business successful. Now, he wants to take out a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional eggs to sell. He wants to have additional capital in order to sustain his operation.

Norberto plans to own a stall in the market where he can display his fresh eggs. He also wants to see all his children successful in their chosen careers.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs to sell

loans.name: Bram

texts.en: Mrs. Bram T. is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband are fishers who are able to earn a little income to support their family. One of the problems they have in their business is not having fishing equipment. Thus, Mrs. Bram T. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat. Mrs. Bram T. is the mother of two children, who are both attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a fishing boat.

loans.name: Fatheyya

texts.en:
Fatheyya is a hard-working mother of three daughters and four sons. She has been running a grocery store for 19 years and using its income to support the family.

One of Fatheyya's sons studies in Ukraine and she covers his tuition fees from the store's income, besides the tuition of her sons and daughters in the village of Al Khader near Bethlehem.

Fatheyya took a loan from FATEN to improve the store, increase the variety of goods she sells and be able to afford the high cost of living.

Fatheyya appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Bethlehem.

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods in the store

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek S. is able to earn a living by working at a private company which is in charge of driving trucks in and around Phnom Penh City. He has been working in this position since 2009 and getting a monthly salary. He has a life partner in his wife who is a clothing seller in the marketplace. Sek S.’s wife has managed her investment carefully and has attracted a large number of customers due to her communications skills. 

In order to better meet her customers' demands, she wishes to purchase more clothing to sell. Because of this, Sek S. decided to ask for a loan from Kiva. This couple has given birth to three children; two are single and the other one is married and living independently.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production/sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more products for her food production/sales business.

Fedila has been in this business for 15 years. Fedila also earns more income selling laundry soap.

Fedila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of sending her kids to school and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food products

loans.name: Mui Thi Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Mui T. N. is 31 years old. She has three children who attend secondary school. Mui is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and potatoes to provide for her family. She also raises chickens for meat and has been running her business for many years. Mui received a loan in 2007 and was able to expand her farm and buy a cow. Since then, she has has a new calf every year and has been able to use her cows for labor. Mui has a good loan repayment record and is a good group leader. She is requesting a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy cattle feed. 

Lanh T. D. has two children. She runs a mechanical workshop that is always busy and she gets orders for services from the local villagers. Lanh is requesting a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy metal to use in her workshop.

Xuyen T. H. is 47 years old and has two children. She manages a workshop that makes aluminum frame doors and windows. Xuyen is requesting a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy materials for her workshop.

Xuyen T. H. is 50 years old. She is raising 100 chickens for meat. Xuyen is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children. He has owned a barber shop in his town for 12 years. He is known in the whole region for his good business reputation and his great customer service. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new products and tools in order to improve his business. He is intent on offering high quality services to his customers. In the future, he is planning to expand his business and open a proper women's beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase new products and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a carpet weaving frame and materials for her business

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en:
Heriberto owns Comanche Auto Recyclers, a business that collects, crushes, and transports old vehicles to metal recycling centers.  Heriberto has been in the waste management industry since 1990, when he and his brothers opened a junk yard.  In 1994, they acquired a metal crusher, which launched Heriberto into the metal recycling business.  Shortly thereafter, he started Comanche Auto Recyclers, which he has been running ever since.

For years, Heriberto went from junkyard to junkyard with his crusher and trailer, looking for salvageable vehicles.  If he saw a vehicle with metal he could use, he bought the car from the junkyard.   If not, he went to the next place, spending fuel and time on the road.  A few months ago, Heriberto changed his business dramatically by moving to a new location where he could weigh scrap metal onsite.  Now, people who want to get rid of their vehicles take them to Heriberto, saving him the hassle of traveling with all of his equipment.  He pays for the vehicles according to their weight, with the price fluctuating according to the price of steel.  He crushes the cars, loads them onto his trailer and then he transports them to a metal recycling center in Seguin, Texas (roughly 40 miles east of San Antonio).

To make this expansion possible, Heriberto rented a new location where his business can operate, bought a portable building that serves as his office and a used scale for weighing cars.  Being hit with all of these expenditures at once strained Heriberto’s cash flow.  Because Heriberto buys all of his cars in cash, it is important that he always have cash on hand.  This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana provides Heriberto the operating capital to continue buying cars as he navigates his business through this transitional period.

Before relocating his business, Heriberto worked long days that often did not finish until 8 or 9 PM.  His new business model allows him to work fewer hours so that he usually finishes work by 6 PM.  As a father of six, he appreciates the opportunity to spend more time at home with his family.  Heriberto has two flatbed trailers that can store up to 18 crushed cars each.  He has two employees, one of whom is his son.  They currently make one trip a day to the recycling center in Seguin, though they hope that once word catches on of their new location, they will be fully utilizing both trailers.

loans.use: to buy cars

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married with two sons and lives in Novomoskovsk. She sells women’s clothing in the central marketplace and has been in this trade for more than 10 years. She offers a variety of merchandise for sale in her kiosk. Presently, she has 20,000 Grivnyas invested in her stock.

Yana is very consistent and focused. She has maintained a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”. The financial wisdom she has demonstrated is one of many reasons why her business has been successful and we believe it will continue to be in the future.

Yana is seeking a 20,000 Grivnyas loan to give her some additional working capital to purchase seasonal inventory and grow her sales.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory.

loans.name: Fotemogoban C Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  C sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur 1er cycle  de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles ont décidés de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de rentabiliser leur exploitation agricole. 
Le prêt sera destiné à l’achat d’une quantité importante de semences, d’intrants et de petits matériels constitués de dabas, de tamis pour la récolte du pois sucré qui est leur principale source de revenu.
NAMINATA, la présidente du groupe, qui est au premier rang des femmes debouts avec une écharpe rouge,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale un tamis et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Les 10 femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  C sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur 1er cycle  de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles ont décidés de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de rentabiliser leur exploitation agricole. 
Le prêt sera destiné à l’achat d’une quantité importante de semences, d’intrants et de petits matériels constitués de dabas, de tamis pour la récolte du pois sucré qui est leur principale source de revenu.
NAMINATA, la présidente du groupe, qui est au premier rang des femmes debouts avec une écharpe rouge,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale un tamis et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de petits matériels agricoles  et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Julieta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo is 46 years old and married. She has three children aged 21, 16 and 13. Consejo is a farmer who tills land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She grows rice to sell to rice traders. 

Consejo works hard to support her family. She has requested a loan to gain financial support for her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase five bags of fertilizer and other farm inputs. Consejo hopes to have a progressive business that will help raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elida Estela

texts.es: Elida Estela: D. 43 años ella es una persona que se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras, ella no cuenta que desD. ya hace varios años se dedica a este negocio,y gracias a Dios,le a ido bien en su negocio, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. frutas y verduras,el sueño D. ella es agrandar su negocio y temer mas ganancias para tener mas oportunidades en el futuro,
texts.en:
Elida Estela is 43 years old and earns her livelihood by selling fruits and vegetables. She says that she started this business several years ago and has done well thanks to God.

Elida is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can have more income and more opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try is a 43-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Charm Province. Try is married to Sophorn, age 50. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have four children: two of the children are garment factory workers in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. and the other two children are school-aged. In view of the rainy season and as  she lacks money for doing farming, Try has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Try will use these funds to buy seeds, fertilizer and other materials. She said that she is very grateful to all lenders for supporting her business in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 42 years old and married with two children aged 19 and 13. She is engaged in farming and plants rice and corn crops to sell. Shirley works hard to keep her crops healthy. She said she wants to be able to sell quality produce to the people in her community.

Shirley is in need of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She has requested a loan because she does not have the capacity to buy the farm inputs she needs right now. Shirley hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kimitir

texts.en:
Kimitir has been a farmer for the last eleven years.  He is 61 years old, married and blessed with ten children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his neighborhood.  He has applied for his second loan, which  he will use  to purchase farm supplies.  He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well known farmer in the area.  He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Kermenbai

texts.ru: Керменбаю 55 лет, женат и воспитывает одного сына. Керменбай в своей деревне Сай известен  как человек  упорный,  трудолюбивый и оптимистичный . После развала Советского Союза, семья Керменбая занялась частным предпринимательством – разведением скота со стартовым капиталом в сумме 10,000 советских рублей.  На сегодняшний день, развитое хозяйство  Керменбая дает прибыль около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи мяса, молока, кефира и др.молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Керменбай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  Прибыль от кредита Керманбай планирует направить на покупку большого сарая с земельным участком.
texts.en: Kermenbai is 55 years old, he is married and is raising one son. Kermenbai is known in his village of Sai as a persistent, hardworking and optimistic man. After the collapse of the Soviet Union Kermenbai's family has started they own business by breeding cattle with a starting capital of 10,000 soviet rubles. Right now the developed business of Kermenbai brings a profit of around 20,000 som (KGS) a month from sales of meat, milk, kefir (thick yogurt drink) and other milk products. With the purpose to further develop his business Kermenbai has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of $100,000 som (KGS) to buy milk cows. Kermenbai plans to use the profit from the loan to buy a large cattle shed with a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola. Fez a 8ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É  comerciante ambulante ha mais de 6 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um familiar que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( sumos, ovos, amendoim, peixe  e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, para o comercio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Amelia was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who go to school. Amelia finished eighth grade and did not continue school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has been making sales on foot for more than six years and has a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Amelia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a relative who is also a customer of this institution. This is her third Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (juices, eggs, peanuts, fish and other items) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 8,000 and 20,000 meticais, and were for the business.

She promises to make her payments with no problems and intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans to build a store in the future.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (juices, eggs, peanuts, nuts, etc.).

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en: Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son and herself. Her son runs a grocery store while she sells bangles. Their business place is the same and they help each other handle the customers in one’s absence. They started their business two years ago. In this short time, they have obtained much respect among their customers due to their good services. With the loan, they will buy groceries and bangles to increase their sales and earns better profits. Her husband is a daily wage labor. She is hopeful that the investment will be profitable for their businesses.

loans.use: To buy groceries & bangles to sell

loans.name: Gilberto Jose

texts.es:
Don Gilberto de profesion fotografo, por mas de once años, sigue con su trabajo poniendo empeño cada dia en la captacion de clientes nuevos, trabajo que hace con vocacion y que afuturo desea mejorar sus accesorios fotograficos por la nueva tecnologia. Trabajo que hace ambulante, en colegios, eventos sociales, cumpleaños y otros.
Su esposa esta trabajando en su pequeño negocio, que sigue adelante, con su pulperia y sus hijos terminando el año escolar.
 Para don Gilberto la construccion de su casa es su prioridad, con el credito anterior logro la construccion en la parte de atrás de los cuartos de concreto, hoy con este nuevo financiamiento seguira levantando paredes, en la parte de enfrente, lo que esta contento por el bien comun de su familia, al poder dar un techo digno.
texts.en:
Gilberto, a professional photographer for more than 11 years, continues his work attracting new clients every day. He does this work as a vocation, and in the future he wants to upgrade his camera accessories on account of the new technology. He does this work on foot, in school, at social events, at birthdays, etc. His wife works in her small grocery business, which continues, and their children have finished the school year.   

For Gilberto, home construction is a priority. With the last loan he built concrete rooms onto the back part. Today with this new financing, he will continue erecting walls in the front part, which he is happy about for the good of his family, to have a proper home.

loans.use: to continue constructing his come with concrete walls in the front part of the house.

loans.name: Gina Helen

texts.en:
Gina Helen is 44-years-old and lives in Mansabay Bajo,Lopez Jaena. She is married with one children. 

To earn a living, Gina Helen has a business of selling of sausage. She earns about PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. Gina Helen has requested a loan to purchase dozens of sausage to sell.

Gina Helen has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Gina Helen would like to invest other type of business for additional sources of income.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of sausage to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has three children, one of them in college. Magdalene owns a retail shop which has been in operation for four years. She also blends fruits and sells the fresh juice.

Magdalene was introduced to Milango by her friend and she is applying for a loan of KES 70,000 to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and soft drinks. Magdalene's main challenge is the rising cost of basic commodities; most people can hardly purchase as they did previously.

Magdalene hopes to own a large store in the future and is committed to owning a wholesale shop in the future. The additional income obtained from this loan will help her pay school fees, invest in shares for old age and purchase a plot/house.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El señor Luis Fernando a sus 41 años de edad y padre de tres hijos, se dedica desde su casa a la crianza de vacas y venta de leche de las mismas. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años. El señor Luis Fernando desea comprar una vaca y así aumentar sus ingresos y a la par mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. El señor Luis Fernando sueña aumentar su lote de ganado y ser un gran empresario.
texts.en: Mr. Luis Fernando, 41 and father of three children, raises cattle from his home and sells their milk and has done so for several years. Mr. Luis Fernando wishes to buy a cow and increase his income to improve his quality of life and that of his family. Mr. Luis Fernando dreams of increasing his herd of cattle and being a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Rosario

texts.es:
Guadalupe, una señora de 56 años sencilla, humilde, risueña y muy trabajadora madre soltera de 5 hijos, ella se dedica a uno de los oficios más comunes pero productivos dentro del comercio de la ciudad de León, como lo son las tortillerías. Aunque ella es originaria de Masatepe, Carazo  lleva 37 años de vivir en León. Ella lamenta mucho el no haber podido estudiar pues sus padres no tenían recursos económicos y tuvo que empezar a trabajar desde muy joven incluso emigrar a otra ciudades que no era la suya en busca de un mejor nivel de vida, trabajo durante mucho tiempo como domestica pero a los 47 años de edad fue que decidió poner su negocio de tortillería con una lata vieja, 2 rajas de leña y una libra de maíz empezó su humilde negocio. Hoy en día lleva 9 años trabajando en su tortillería que elabora y vende dentro de su vecindario las mayoría de sus clientes son amas de casa que desde tempranas horas esperan que abra su negocio para desayunar esas calientitas y recién hechas tortillas con maíz. 
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar maíz, leña, cal y frijoles, pues son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar y vender sus apetecidas tortillas . Uno de sus planes es ir mejorando poco a poco su casa y la cocina donde elabora las tortillas y venta de frijoles cosidos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is an unassuming 56 year-old woman who is humble, cheerful and hardworking.  She is the single mother of 5 children, and she works in one of the most common but productive trades in the city of Leon - as a tortilla-maker.  Although she is a native of Masatepe, Carazo, she has been living in Leon for 37 years.
