For the past three years, she has operated a juice-making business and has also been making natural soap for sale using chemicals. She operates from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Mgeni faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase chemicals for making natural soap and flavors and sugar for making juice drinks. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals for making natural soap and flavors and sugar for making juice drinks.

loans.name: Lorene

texts.en:
Lorene is 24 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lorene has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Lorene has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Lorene has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Lorene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza De San Luis Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Luis de la  Ciudad de Caaguazú, son 21 (Veinte y un) señoras trabajadoras, solidarias y responsables, que decidieron formar un grupo de mujeres, cuyo fin es recibir un pequeño préstamo de la Fundación Paraguaya para invertir en sus trabajos diarios,con el deseo de incrementar las ventas y recibir más ganancia para beneficio personal y de toda la familia.
La Sra. Librada desea dedicarse a la venta de ropas y confección de bijouteries para lo cual necesita de este crédito que será destinado a la compra de remeras, blusas, pantalones, camperas, camisas, shorts, asimismo hilos, agujas, perlitas, acrílicos, entre otros elementos necesarios para iniciarse en esta actividad y poder superarse diariamente.
texts.en:
This committee formed in the city of Caaguazú’s San Luis neighborhood.  It has 21 members.  They are hard working, mutually supportive and responsible women who decided to form a group of women whose goal is to receive a small loan from Fundación Paraguaya to invest in their daily jobs hoping to increase sales and receive more profits for their own personal and their families’ wellbeing.

Librada wants to go into clothes and notions sales and needs the loan to buy t-shirts, blouses, pants, jackets, shirts, shorts as well as thread, needles, seed pearls, acrylics, among other necessary supplies to get started in this activity and to be able to improve herself daily.

loans.use: to buy clothes and to buy notions.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak, 37, is a gardener. Her husband, Sok, 44, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1996 and have four children--three sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City

Vannak is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old requires frequent costly repairs. 

Photo: Vannak and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Nakyesa Naffe Tuveyo Group

texts.en: Jaiia is 47 years old, divorced, and has seven children. She is full of energy, optimism, and determination. For the last two years, Jaiia has been expanding her poultry business, which she took over from her former husband. She operates her business from Kayunga district. Before Jaiia got involved in this enterprise, she was running a grocery business. Her weekly profits are 150,000 shillings. Jaiia is requesting a loan to enable purchase more layer chickens.

loans.use: to purchase of layer chickens.

loans.name: Kadammurod

texts.ru: Кадаммурод проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 40 лет. Женат. У него семеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более четырех лет Кадаммурод занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин бытовой техники. Кредит берет для приобретения новых моделей техники для продажи.
texts.en: Kadammurod lives in the region of Hamadoni. He is 40 years old. He is married and has seven children. He has secondary education. For more than four years Kadammurod has been selling on the market. He has a store where he sells household appliances. He is asking for a loan to buy new models of electronics for sale.

loans.use: to buy new models of electronics

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 30, is married to Rahab and they are blessed with two children aged four and two. He runs a boutique which has been in operation for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy more clothes for resale. Joseph intends to open another boutique for his wife using the anticipated profits and hopes to grow his business and own a piece of land in future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gian Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin es un joven trabajador de 22 años que vive con sus padres y hermanos en la comunidad rural del distrito de  Razuri en Ascope. Marvin es un joven que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Marvin ofrece su servicios  de codificación de sacos de harina en las fábricas de su comunidad. Él cuenta con sus propias herramientas de trabajo y su servicio es muy solicitado por las empresas. Marvin tiene muchos deseos de superación y su familia lo apoya en las actividades que este realiza para cumplir sus metas.

Marvin desea invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar su trabajo y cumplir con  sus pedidos y contratos. Por ello solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para poder adquirirlos.

 Marvin ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y su crédito anterior fue cancelado con puntualidad y responsabilidad. Su negocio ha ido creciendo grancias a nuestra ayuda financiera y Marvin quiere continuar con ese buen camino.
texts.en:
Marvin, 22, is a young worker living with his parents and siblings in the rural community of Razuri District in Ascope.  Marvin is a young man who enjoys good personal and work-related references.

Marvin provides a flour sack codification service to factories in his community.  He has his own work tools and his services are highly sought after by the firms.  Marvin very much wants to get ahead and his family supports his efforts in the activities he does to reach his goals.

Marvin wants to buy materials needed to do his job and fill his requests and contracts.  Because of this he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to be able to acquire them.

Marvin has worked with our firm previously and his last loan was repaid punctually and responsibly.  His business has been growing thanks to our financial help and Marvin wants to stay on this good path.

loans.use: to buy flour sack codification tools.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  lives in  Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. Mary has a drug shop. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for over 10 years. 

Mary works seven days a week. She generates additional income through poultry farming. Her major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Her aspiration is to build her own clinic and also to own a fully stocked drug shop. 

Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more  boxes of drugs, beds, and dressing tables. Mary lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly  expenses are  rent for the clinic, school fees, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs, beds, dressing tables and pay rent for her business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 29 years old and married to Mary. They are not blessed with children ye. He has been running a spare parts business as his primary business and a general store as his other source of income for the last five years, making a monthly profit of KES 40,000. He has been loaned KES 90,000, which he plans to use to add more stock of spare parts to add more stock of spare parts like wheel spanner, spare tyres,reflectors, jerks, lights, windows etc.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to open another shop. In the near future, he hopes to own a matatu (a transport vehicle).

loans.use: to add more stock of spare parts like wheel spanner, spare tyres, reflectors, jerks, lights, windows etc

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is 50 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She finished her tertiary education but due to the lack of job opportunities she is engaged in selling beauty products in their village to generate income. They want to continue sending their children to school for they want them to become professionals someday. They need to work hard and earn income to cover their needs and finance their education. Sometimes, they experience financial shortages due to the high cost of commodities and school fees. 

In this regard, Cesaria wants to ask for additional capital of P8,000 to buy lotions, deodorants, bath soaps, shampoos and papaya soaps to sell in the village. She believes that this loan will help her to make the business grow. She hopes that her business will become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, bath soaps, shampoos and papaya soaps to sell in the village.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years.  He is 46 years old, married to Hannah, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount as capital to open up a shoe shop.

In future, David hopes to grow as a farmer and also as a shoe retailer.

loans.use: To open a shoe shop.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is a 47-year-old mother of six, the youngest two years old. Two children are still in school, while the others have completed secondary school. Her husband works in construction in small villages, and Annonciata has a general store which sells rice, sugar, soap, and beans.

Having run this business for the last three years, she has seen it grow as she reinvests the profits. Now requesting a loan to buy more products for her store, Annonciata will use the profits to build a house from which to run her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, rice, soaps and beans.

loans.name: Maurice Otieno

texts.en:
Maurice is a Kenyan man aged 41. He is married with four children. He runs a soft drinks sales business. The business is situated in a bus terminus that is very busy, and his customers are travelers. He has been in the business for 10 years. He says that the business is good and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and the escalating prices of commodities. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase stock of soft drinks to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He also hopes to grow his cafe by putting up a permanent premises to run it in the future. He describes himself as God fearing, aggressive, responsible and humble.

loans.use: To buy stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casada y vive con sus hijos y su esposo  actualmente. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra cerdos para engordarlos. Ella cuenta con el local apto para la explotación adecuada de cerdos, además ella a trabajo con estos animales desde varios años atrás por lo cual quiere invertir comprando unos para luego venderlos al mercado de la localidad. Ella tiene como meta generar las ganancias para salir adelante con los pagos del crédito y mejorar cada día su estabilidad económica y su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gladis is 48 years old, married, and currently lives with her husband and children.  She plans to use this loan to buy pigs to fatten.  She has a suitable location for raising the pigs and, furthermore, she has been working with these animals for several years.  She would like to invest in buying some pigs which she will later sell in the local market.  Her goal is to make profits with which she will make her loan repayments and also improve her financial stability and her family well-being.

This is the first loan that Gladis has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 48 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.  She runs a restaurant to earn a living, from which she earns about PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her business.

Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her business

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a musical instrument and also candies for his new business.

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alejandro es casado, tiene 32 años de edad, curso el primer año de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica ala tejeduría, iniciando su negocio como trabajador y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, recibe el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al tricotado de hilos.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para capital en la compra de hilos ya que es un insumo principal en la realización de su trabajo, espera en el futuro tener un capital amplio.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Alejandro is 32 years old, married and has a 3rd grade education. He has 3 children who are studying. He works as a weaver starting his business as a worker and up until now has 10 years experience in the work. His wife works knitting yarn and supports him.

He is asking for a loan with which to buy thread as it the main material used in his work. He hopes to have a large capital in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Doña Amelia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Doña Amelia sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así  por que se indefinan con  su grupo .
Este grupo  esta conformado por  diez integrantes  con deseos de superarse día  día ya que gracias a dios todos cuentan con un pequeño negocio.
La integrante de este grupo es la señora Amelia  quien se dedica a la venta de carne desde hace treinta años.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio  es matar la res y tasajear la carne .
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Roberto quien la apoya y también se dedica a la venta de carne.
Doña Ame como le dicen las personas de su localidad es una señora trabajadora humilde y lechona  ya que cuando no tiene venta en su localidad va a vender a vender a pueblos vecinos.
Tiene  un hijo quien le ayuda a matar la res y a atender a los clientes.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  cuchillo,mesa,tabla para  tasajear.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Teofila-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
María-se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Constancia-se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Elías-se dedica a la venta de pan.
Alma- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Amelia- se dedica a la venta de carne.
Josellesica- quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Silvia- quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Elodia- quien se dedica a la venta de quesos.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida y seguir cumpliendo sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called “Doña Amelia.”  Its members decided to call it that because they identify with their group.  It has ten members who wish to improve day to day since each has their own business, thanks to God.  


The group member is Amelia who has been selling meat for thirty years.  She tells us that what she likes best about her work is slaughtering the beef and butchering the meat.  She is happily married to Roberto who supports her efforts and also sells meat.  Doña Ame, like people in her community call her, is a hardworking, humble, tenacious woman who goes out to neighboring towns to sell when sales drop in her own location.  She has a son who helps her kill the steers and helps her tend to customers.  She requested the loan to buy knives and a butcher’s block.


The other group members are:

Teofila-sells Mexican fast food snacks.
María-sells clothes.
Constancia-sells chickens.
Elías-sells bread.
Alma- sells Mexican fast food snacks.
Amelia- sells meat.
Josellesica- sells food.
Silvia- sells chickens.
Elodia- sells cheese.


She thanks the Fundación for the support it’s given her to get ahead and succeed in life and continue reaching her dreams.

loans.use: to buy knives and a butcher's block.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose has been in farming for six years with his farm producing beans, eggs and maize for the local market. He says his family of six children, whose  ages are between 1 and 15 years, have been relying on farming as the only source of income.

Ambrose has made a request for a loan amounting to 61,200 KES to help him venture into dairy farming by buying and insuring a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and using the remaining 30,000 KES to boost his poultry farming by buying more poultry birds. He aspires to own five dairy cows in five years.

He mentions the high costs of feeds as the major farming challenge in the area.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació.(El distrito peruano de Huayllabamba es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú). 

Carmen Rosa tiene 56 años edad, es casada y ya son varios años que lleva casada con su esposo y tiene una bonita relación de la cual tienen dos hijos, ella tiene tres actividades económicas principales que realiza durante el año y estos son: ella se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de chicha de jora y a la crianza de animales menores, ella durante los meses de abril hasta octubre se dedica cultivar y sembrar como por ejemplo maíz, zapallos, zanahorias, tomates y otras verduras pero durante los meses de Octubre a Marzo se dedica al negocio de venta de choclo, ella lleva sus choclos a vender a las ciudades de Juliaca y Arequipa y los choclos distribuye a los diferentes mercados mayoristas de esas ciudades. En esta oportunidad Carmen Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar choclos. Su sueño de Carmen Rosa es comprar un carro para poder transportar sus productos pues actualmente lo que hacer es alquilar un camión para llevar sus productos.    

Carmen Rosa es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en la ciudad de Yucay. El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa was born in the city of Huayllabamba, and this is where she still lives.  The Peruvian district of Huayllabamba is one of the seven districts of Urubamba province, located in the department of Cusco in the Cusco region of Peru.

Carmen Rosa is 56 years old and married.  She has been married to her husband for a number of years, and they have a beautiful relationship that has produced two children.  Carmen Rosa has three main economic activities that she carries out during the year, these are: farming, the sale of chicha de jora (a traditional Peruvian beverage made from corn), and raising small animals.  During the months of April through October she plants and cultivates corn, squash, carrots, tomatoes and other vegetables, but during the months of October through March she has a business selling choclo (a Peruvian variety of corn with large kernels).  She takes her corn to sell in the cities of Juliaca and Arequipa where she distributes it in the different wholesale markets in those cities.  At this time, Carmen Rosa needs a loan to buy corn.  Carmen Rosa's dream is to buy a car to use in transporting her products, since now she has to rent a van to take her products to the market.

Carmen Rosa is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Natividad," which has 15 members who live in the city of Huayllabamaba, and others who live in the city of Yucay.  Yucay district is one of the seven districts of the province of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Lidia Sonia

texts.es: Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Llankasum, tiene 39 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas por mayor y menor en las ferias, es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, aprendió a ser puntual y como administrar su negocio, con las capacitaciones que le brindaron, la relación con su familia es mejor porque aprendió como tratar a sus hijos, ahora ella solicita los préstamos lo necesario para su negocio para no sobre- endeudarse, agradece mucho por todo lo aprendido, el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, su deseo es poder tener su empresa.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Llankasum communal bank. She is 39 years old and works selling clothing, both wholesale and retail, at fairs. She has four children and has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. Lidia has learned to make punctual repayments and to manage her business. With the training she has received, the relationship with her family is better, because she has learned how to look after her children. 

She is now asking to borrow the money she needs for her business, without over-borrowing. She is very grateful for all that she has learned. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of clothing. Her dream is to have her own company.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos varónes de 8, 13, 14, 15, 24 y 27 años y 2 hijas de 9 y 22 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de Alpaca. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘chasquipampa’ área donde crece el nuevo eje comercial de la ciudad y que además es la zona de mayor expansión y crecimiento, tanto de población como de construcción. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-17 grados centígrados. 
Antonia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y no cuenta con agua potable ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de mantas de lana de alpaca, actividad que realiza de forma independiente utilizando su casa como taller, su hija menor le colabora en el hilado, para la venta reparte su mercadería en diferentes tiendas comerciales de primer nivel para realizar el cobro una semana después, “La lana de Alpaca no sofoca el calor, es un tejido bueno contra el frío y la humedad, se caracteriza por atemperar la zona en la que es usada, la lana de Alpaca no contiene lanolina, esto es favorable porque no Pica ni irrita la piel...” comenta. Su sueño es realizar confecciones por mayor para empresas y abrir una tienda cercana a su domicilio. Ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de lana de alpaca para confeccionar prendas por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera continua. 
Es por esos motivos que Antonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para confeccionar prendas y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has six sons, who are 8, 13, 14, 15, 24 and 27 years old, and two daughters who are 9 and 22. Her business is weaving alpaca shawls. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, reliable, responsible and very hard-working. She carries out her business in the "Chasquipampa" zone, an area which is emerging as a new commercial axis for the city, and which is also an area of great expansion and growth, both in population and construction. The area has a cold and dry climate, with daytime temperatures varying between 2 and 17 degrees Centigrade. 

Antonia has brown skin, dark eyes and braided black hair. She is short in stature with a slender build. She dresses in traditional clothing (hat, skirt and shawl). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, but for her business she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and with her children, who are studying and working. They live in a house of their own, built of brick and cement, which has electricity but does not have drinking water or sewer connections. 

Her business is making shawls from alpaca wool. She does this work in an independent manner, using her home as a workshop. Her younger daughter works with her in spinning the wool. For her sales, she distributes her merchandise to various commercial retail stores and receives payment a week later. She comments, "Alpaca wool does not concentrate heat; it is a good material that protects against cold and humidity. It regulates the temperature in areas where are used, alpaca wool does not contain lanolin; it is an advantage because it does not scratch or irritate the skin."  Her dream is to make garments on a wholesale basis for businesses, and to open a shop near her home. She wants to buy alpaca wool on a wholesale basis to make garments to sell wholesale. This is her first loan sequence with the institution during the 5 years she has continuously dedicated to this work. 

For these reasons, Antonia is requesting a loan to buy alpaca wool on a wholesale basis to make clothing to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool on a wholesale basis to make clothing to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 22 years old; she is married and has two children. One is in primary school and the other is very young. She is an active member of Kagaa Women Group and adheres to the rules and regulations of the group. She sells used clothes and eggs from her small Poultry business which she started in 2004.

From her poultry business, she sells 3 trays of eggs to Ngurueni Market every day. She employs one person who assists her in running her clothes business. She uses her poultry waste as manure on her land and this enriches the soils very much, she has a piece of land where she gets vegetables for the family. Therefore, she does not spend on vegetables.

She wants to buy chickens and buy a bale of first class used clothes. This will increase her returns as well as her income. She is dedicated to her work and believes it will influence other young mothers in her community who think they can’t make it in life.

loans.use: Beatrice wants to buy a bale of used clothes and 50 layers chickens.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region , settled in  Absheron region. He is married and has 2 children.His business is the sale of cut-glass wares.
He works hard for the success of his children. With this business he meets the needs of his family. He has been in this business for 5 years.
Having borrowed $400 he bought cut-glass wares.
The second time he borrowed $600 and made shelves.
The third time he borrowed $1000 and bought cut-glass wares.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to open the shop.

loans.use: To open a new shop

loans.name: Siapu

texts.en: Siapu M. is a widow with six children and two grandchildren.  Since her husband’s passing, she has found it difficult to care for her family financially from her taro plantation which is her only source of income.  She has used micro-loan facilities to keep investing in her plantation and ensure that this income source remains viable.  She is currently seeking loan funds to purchase weed killers, insecticides and fertilizers to improve her crop yield and thus enhance her income.

loans.use: To buy weed killers, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra Patricia is 32 years and a single mother of a precious 3-year-old girl who is in kinder garden. Sandra started selling shoes and home decorating goods through catalog order two years ago because she became reponsible for supportting herself and her daughter, while still giving her the care and attention necessary. She was able to sell her merchandise to her friends when she first started up and, after that, her clientele began to grow gradually. This is how she has been providing for her daughter.

Sandra needs a loan in the amount of $475.00 to fulfill the orders she has received. This amount will be used to purchase merchandise. She commits to repaying the loan within 6 months. You could help improve this family’s living standards by contributing to the growth of the business. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra Patricia tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de una preciosa niña de 3 años que estudia preescolar. Sandra inició con la venta de zapatos y artículos decorativis para el hogar por catálogo hace dos años, por la responsabilidad que tiene de sacar adelante a su hija ella sola y a la vez tener el tiempo para darle el cuidado y las atenciones que necesita. Comenzó vendiendo con sus amistades y poco a poco ha incrementado su número de clientes, de esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.

Para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene, Sandra solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Herlinda Trinidad

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Herlinda Trinidad. I am am entrepreneur and I own a small grocery store at my home, named "Pulperia Isis Karina". It generates the income needed to contribute to pay for the family expenses, and it allows me to take care of my children myself.

At this moment, I would like to better stock my business so I can offer a greater variety of products to my customers, as the location of my store is very good.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola Mi nombre es Herlinda Trinidad, mi actividad principal es el comecio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia "ISIS KARINA" tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia y lo mas impotante es que me permite cuidar a mi hijos.

Actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, ya que la ubicación de mi negocio es muy buena.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, shortening, rice, soap, dairy, sausages, and basic grains.

loans.name: Fetoai

texts.en: Fetoai is 38 years old and married with 4 children.  Her husband is a farmer who cares for their plantation.  Fetoai has always had a hard time raising her children, and to take care of them when they are sick.  They have worked hard over the years.  This is Fetoai's 4th loan with SPBD and with her loans she has been able to do so much good for the family. With the loan she will be able to purchase equipment needed for the plantation.  It will help to bring in a profit, and to support the family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mrs. Khim S., age 35, works with her husband raising pigs and making medicinal wine. They earn together around $8 each day. They have three children: one is a garment worker making about $75 per month, and two are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a water pump machine to draw well water more efficiently, build a barn to house her livestock, and purchase better feed for her livestock. Her husband is pictured in the photo standing in front of her livestock as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump machine to draw well water more efficiently, build a barn to house her livestock, and purchase better feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: My name is Sughran B. and I live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  My husband and I have five children: four sons and one daughter. I make jewelry tassels on daily wages and my husband operates a fruit cart. He would like to expand that business by purchasing a greater variety of fruit and for this he requires a loan of $175. I hope to start my own jewelry tassels business in the future and increase our household income.

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of fruit for resale

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru:
Shamigul M. is 52 years old, has finished high school, is married and has 5 children. Shamigul has been embroidering and selling Tajik folk costumes for the last 8 years. She is planning to use the loan to purchase necessary embroidery supplies for her business. This loan will provide the locals with a source of hand-made folk costumes, since it is increasingly difficult to find high quality work like this. Locally, national Tajik costumes are in high demand, since they are used in weddings and other traditional ceremonies. Mrs. M. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Мачнунова Шаъмигул, возраст – 52 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Шаъмигул занимается вышивкой национальных изделий и их продажей. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение необходимого материала для этого вида деятельности. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 8 лет. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям района приобретать у неё нациоанальные изделия ручной работы, так как не всегда в продаже имеются такие изделия. Они пользуются спросом у местного населения, так как их используют при проведение свадебных и других национальных обрядов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of embroidery supplies

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline J. is a 36 year old woman who lives with her husband, niece, and seven children (ages: 14, 12, 9, 6, 4, 2 and 4 months). Her husband is currently unemployed and has found it very difficult to secure a job. She currently has problems providing for her children – they are often sick with either a cold or asthma. Her 4 year old son, David, suffers from a chronic illness. She currently sells clothing from her home but hopes that one day she will have her own “colmado,” which is a very small grocery store. She is looking forward to this loan because it will allow her to expand her business and buy more clothing to sell.

This group lives in a small community about 40 minutes outside of Puerto Plata. Most of the people in the community are Haitian and came to the Dominican Republic in hopes of finding a better life. Jobs are extremely difficult to come by here; the unemployment rate in these smaller towns can be as high as 25%. Disease and sickness are very prevalent in this specific area due to the lack of capital available for medical care or medicine.

This is a very close and tight knit group. They rely on each other for emotional and financial support. With the loan from Kiva and business skills and supervision from Esperanza, these individuals are able to pursue their dreams and start their own small businesses.

Oh behalf of Esperanza and everyone in this group, thank you for your continued support and generosity. God Bless!

loans.use: to expand her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Flora Martha's Group

texts.es:
Juana, Flora, and Sonia joined the communal bank "Poder" five years, five years, and four months ago, respectively.

Juana lives with her partner, is 34 years old and has five children. She travels to fairs twice a week where she sells groceries. From the fairs, she brings home grains that she sells in the Nery García market. Also, Juana sells fruit out of her house.

For her part, Flora is married, is 32 years old, and has three children. Flora travels to various fairs in the Ayacucho region where she buys grains, cheese, young animals, and other products that she sells at market in the city of Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Sonia is married, is 24 years old and has three children. She weaves beautiful sweaters, and embroiders blankets and bags, an activity she does for businesses and shops. With this loan, Sonia will make a down payment toward purchasing a motortaxi.

Juana, Flora and Sonia need loans for 1500, 400, and 400 soles ($825 total), money that will be invested in buying wheat, quinoa, barley, broad bean, peas, corn, cheese, and the down payment on a motortaxi.

Juana, Flora, Sonia dream of their children becoming professionals, of improving their businesses, and of having homes of their own.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juana, Flora y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Poder hace 5 años, 5 años, 4 meses respectivamente.

Juana es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Juana viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana, donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias trae cereales que vende en el mercado Nery García. Además Juana vende frutas en su casa.

Por otro lado Flora es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Flora viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de Ayacucho de donde compra cereales, queso, animales menores, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Sonia es casada, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Sonia teje bellas chompas, borda manteles, mochilas, actividad que realiza para empresas y tiendas. Sonia con el préstamo que obtendrá pagará la inicial para comprar una mototaxi.

Juana, Flora y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 1500 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, quinua, cebada, haba, arveja, maíz, queso y para la inicial de su mototaxi.

Los sueños de Juana, Flora y Sonia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio, tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for resale and for down payment on a motor taxi

loans.name: Berlita

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertila Tuamama S. belongs to the Communal Bank “Sarita Colonia” and lives in the San Martín area of Mariscal Cáceres province in Juanjui district. Her business is located in Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza, where she makes wooden crates to ship fruits and vegetables to other parts of the state and country. She also sells fruits from the region.

Thanks to the support of her husband and daughters and the her own great effort she has been able to grow her business, earning the appreciation and gaining a large clientele.

With the S/.1000.00 loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy wood, glue and nails to make crates as well as various fruits from the region like: oranges, cocona fruit by the hundred, kilos of sapote, bunches of bananas, sacks of fresh and dried coconut, papayas.

Bertila is 47 years old, she works daily demonstrating that she is a hard-working woman and that to accomplish her goals, there aren’t any limits and she can achieve her goals with effort and dedication, so in thinking of her future she is thinking about opening a juice stand in her home and she wants to be a wholesale crate maker.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Bertila Tuamama S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza, se dedica a la fabricación de cajas de madera para el envío de frutas y verduras a otras partes del departamento y del país. También se dedica a la venta de frutas de la región.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijas y al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, habiendo ganado el aprecio y la acogida de una gran clientela.

Con el crédito de S/.1000.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará madera para la fabricación de las cajas, clavos y pegamento, asimismo diversas frutas de la región como: naranjas, taperivas, coconas en cientos, zapotes kilos, plátanos y guineos en racimos, cocos fresco y seco en sacos , papayas todo esto en cientos.

La señora Bertila tiene 47 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una juguería en su casa y ser mayorista de la fabricación de las cajas.

loans.use: Buy wood, nails and glue for crates as well as various fruits.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en: Sughran Baji is the wife of Faqeer H. who has been living in a city in Pakistan. Her husband is a shopkeeper by profession. She looks after the shop in his absence because her husband works as a security guard. Her daily income is $4 to $6. She applies for a loan for her husband’s business. Her husband wants to diversify the products so that the customers can buy everything from his shop. She plans to invest all her loan amount into her husband’s grocery shop to earn a good profit.

loans.use: Diversify the business

loans.name: Ana Bertha's Group

texts.es: Hola Mi nombre es Ana H.  tengo 30 años de edad, estoy casada y tengo 3 hijos los cuales estan en la escuela primaria. soy comerciante, vivo en esta comunidad hace 8 años y hace 6 años me dedico a la venta de productos para la agricultura como ser agroquimicos, tengo mi negocio en mi casa de habitacion esto me ayuda mucho ya que no pago ningun alquiler por vender mi producto, actualmente estoy solicitando apoyo monetario para poder surtir con mas productos mi negocio ya que las ventas son buenas pero las ganancias son pocas y teniendo mas productos mis ganancias aumentarias mucho mas, este producto tiene demanda aqui en nuestra comunidad y aldeas vecinas, mis hijos me colaboran en sus tiempos libres, yo me encuentro bien contenta con mi negocio ya que sin descuidar a mi familia puedo generar ingresos para la misma que es lo que mas me importa en mi vida.

loans.use: compra de Gramoxone, Paragua, Remansato, Xaprin.

loans.name: Safina's Mto Group

texts.en:
Safina is 49 years old. She is a married woman with three children aged 21, 19, and 15. She also takes care of three other children. She became a chicken seller in 1994. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $500.

In the past, Safina has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Safina now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with selling chickens, spears, vegetables, and milk.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Suvada

texts.en: Suvada is 36 years old. She is married and living in Klokotnica near the town Doboj. She has two children. Her husband is self-employed in agriculture. He has his own machines which he uses to do anything agricultural for his clients. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 1000 KM.  In her current business she raises sheep. She plans to use this loan to buy vaccines for the sheep because she already has 20 sheep.  Her future goal is to expand the number of sheep and to protect them from diseases, and she hopes that she will manage it with these vaccines.

loans.use: To buy vaccines

loans.name: Patricia Amelia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.

Patricia es soltera y tiene 38 años, Patricia es docente y trabaja en una institución educativa que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Patricia en sus ratos libres vende calzados, ropa, carteras y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes que son amigos, familiares y colegas de su trabajo, sus ventas son al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja y también su hermana que vive en Lima le envía sus pedidos.

Patricia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados en diferentes modelos. Patricia sueña con tener un local estable donde venda sus productos, tener una familia y seguir especializándose en su carrera.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank 'Primavera' (Spring).

Patricia is single and is 38 years old, she is a teacher and works in an educational institution 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. In her free time Patricia sells footwear, clothes, wallets and anything that her clients, who are friends, family members and work colleagues, ask for. Her sales are on credit, and she gets her products by traveling to the city of Lima, or being sent them by her sister, who lives in Lima.

Patricia needs a loan of 2000 soles; money that will be invested in buying different types of shoes. Patrica's dream is to have a stable store from where she can sell her products, to have a family and to carry on specializing in her career.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Patricia needs a loan of 2000 soles; money that will be invested in buying different types of footwear/Patricia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados en diferentes modelos.

loans.name: Milagritos

texts.es: Milagritos, de 33 años, tiene tres hijos, quienes son el significado de su vida y de seguir luchando por salir adelante, es madre soltera y esta responsabilidad, no le imposibilita seguir con su meta , es por eso que trabaja duro para sus hijos, esperando que algún día sean profesionales.  Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, desde hace ya mucho tiempo, este negocio es el que vela por el sustento económico de ella y de sus hijos, a quienes les brinda lo necesario para sus estudios. Su propósito es ampliar su negocio, comprar productos comestibles y también mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Milagritos logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Milagritos, 33, has three children who are the meaning of her life and who keep her struggling to get ahead. She is a single mother, and this responsibility does not hinder her from keeping up with her goal. She works hard for her children, hoping that some day they will become professionals. She sells groceries and daily necessities; this business has been the economic support of herself and her children, for whom she provides everything necessary for their education. Her proposal is to increase her business, buying edible products, and also to structurally improve her home. For this she needs the capital to carry her goals to completion. Thanks to your help, Mrs. Milagritos will soon achieve her object.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her shop, as well as structural improvements to her house, where the shop is located.

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people in Stueng Village in Kandal Province make up the village bank [solidarity group] taking out this loan. All the members in this village bank will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sao M. is a village bank president, who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she breeds pigs. As her pigs are bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to buy pig food. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food to feed her pigs. Mrs. Sao M. is a 46-year-old widow with a child who is a car driver for a company. That child can make a small salary to support the household.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Abel

texts.fr: Né vers 1978 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur   A. Abel est marié et père de 4 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 140 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1978 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. Abel A. is married and the father of four children one of whom is enrolled in school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the GH Missimahou Group of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work their fields after the waters of the river Ouémé have receded. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their main crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem of these people who dwell along the river is that, when the river floods, they have no work and spend on food all the money they earned farming.

When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay workers who are indispensable to help them cultivate the area available to them. At this point many sell the future rights to their harvest which does not make them any more secure, but only makes things worse. They sell the rights to their future harvest to a wealthier person for a laughable sum so that they have enough money to be able to work their fields.

Weary of this system, Abel A. is requesting a loan of 140,000 F CFA so as to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing the above-mentioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: farming 1.5 hectares, raising corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a member of the Legion Village Bank. Hilda travels to different regional markets on weekends to sell dry goods and buy grains and potatoes. During the week, she works as a cook at a restaurant. Hilda and her husband also own a car, which he uses as a taxi. Hilda needs a loan of 1500 soles to paint the car. Hilda dreams of owning her own restaurant and dry goods store as well as providing her children with a good education. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. Hilda es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Hilda viaja a las diferentes ferias los días sábados y domingos en donD. venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias adquiere cereales, papa, mientras que los demás días trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante. Además Hilda junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico. Hilda necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido para pintar su carro. Hilda sueña con tener un restaurante, una tienda D. abarrotes y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Paint taxi

loans.name: Borei

texts.en: Mrs. Borei Y. was born in 1979 and she now lives in Ro Neam Tnort village in Takeo province. She has four children who all attend the local school. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy 12 piglets for breeding.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to feed them. Her husband, Mr. Sun Mao, is an ice-cream seller. He is also in the picture.

loans.use: To buy 12 piglets for breeding and to buy pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Piggery and farming are the sole sources of income of Olivia and her family. Her husband is in charge of managing their farm but he also helps her in maintaining her piggery. They have two children; Oliver, 13 years old, a high school student and Vincent, 11 years old and in the elementary level. The couple is working hard for the future of their children and for them to be free from poverty.

To able to restart her piggery business, Olivia wants to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy a piglet and feed. She believes that this business will grow and it will support the education of their two sons. Pig-raising has been her business ever since, however, it was stopped for a while due to lack of capital.

The couple is thankful for this opportunity for they believe that in this way, they can uplift their standard of living; they also pray for good health.

loans.use: To buy a piglet and feed

loans.name: Luong

texts.vi:
Chị Đàm Thị Lương năm nay 43 tuổi, chị là thành viên Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn, gà  và trồng trọt tại xã Phù Linh huyện Sóc Sơn - Hà Nội. Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị dang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. Đàm Thị Lương is 43 yrs old, and has been a member of TYM fund since 1998. Presently both she and her husband raise pigs, chickens and vegetable farming in the village of Phù Linh in the district of Sóc Sơn in Hà Nội. With income of 145 USD from raising animals, her family meets the conditions necessary to improve their lives. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to purchase additional pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Choy

texts.en:
Mr. Choy S., a 58-year-old farmer living in Ta Preas Village in Takeo Province, cultivates rice on a plot of land he owns. His wife, Mrs. Haum Phan, is a grocer.  Choy is requesting a loan to buy six piglets plus pig food and to build a piggery. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions with this loan. 

Choy is the father of four children, two of whom are employed while the others are attending the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy six piglets plus pig food and to  build a piggery.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 43 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells kitchen utensils such as pots, plates, spoons, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama Mané, 42 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Adama Mané, 42, is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 4 years. Her business consists of buying peanuts to transform into peanut butter for sale. She wants this loan to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Safina Nakalema‘S Group

texts.en: Safina is the leader of a group with 4 members. She is a 49-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 12 and 20. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a one-room house where she is staying with three people. Safina takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Safina operates a restaurant in Nakulabye, one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells to all kinds of customers, serving an average of 20 people a day. She works six days a week. Safina buys all the food she requires from Nakulabye market and doesn't pay extra for transportation to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses are rent for the business premises and her residence. She has been in this business for the last two years. Her main challenge is the rainy season, which stops her customers from coming to her restaurant. Safina has been with MCDT for over two years and is requesting her fourth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more saucepans, plates, and cups. She aspires to open up another eating joint.

loans.use: To buy saucepans, plates, and cups

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es:
La señora Adelfa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte cdra. 01, Distrito Banda de Bellavista, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años, 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Adelfa, se dedica a la Venta de Cocos Heladitos, nos cuenta que ya lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio, pero para implementarse y aumentar mas su negocio, decidió sacar un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00.
Vende sus cocos por las calles en una carretilla y también en su casa, sus clientes ya la conocen y saben del trabajo que realiza.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que día a día compran sus cocos, entre ellos están sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando 500 cocos, y una parte del dinero también lo utilizara cancelando la última cuota de la congeladora de segunda mano que compró, la cual le es de gran ayuda en su negocio.

Adelfa se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y en la ayuda que brinda a muchas mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Adelfa is a member of the Community Bank "Las Nazarenas". She lives at 1 Alfonso Ugarte in the district of Bellavista in San Martin. She is 38 years old and she lives with her common-law husband and her son who is still under her care.

Adelfa sells frozen treats. She says that she has running this business for many years now. She sought out her first loan of S/.300 to invest in her business. She sells coconuts in the streets from a wheel barrow, as well as from her home. She is well known to her clients and they know of the attention she gives to her work.

Currently she is still running the same business but now she has a steady clientele that buy from her on a daily basis. Among them are her friends, family and neighbours. She earns a good monthly income and her sales better than she can hope for.

This loan of S/1000 will be invested in the purchase of 500 coconuts, and a part of these funds will be used to pay off the balance owed from the freezer she bought second hand. It has been of enormous help to her business.

Adelfa is very happy for what she has achieved and because her business is prospering. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the support provided in the start up of her business, and for the help provided to so many women who want to develop their businesses.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 500 coconuts.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26 year old Leticia N. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 6 years old. Leticia has been running a tailoring business since 2008. Her business is to make womens clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Leticia currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase materials and a sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Leticia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of Unidos. She is 53 years old. Fe is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Retamas Group

texts.es: La asociación “Retamas”  pertenece al centro focal Villa Adela, a la fecha esta formado por doce miembros, su presidenta y fundadora es Viviana I., formo el grupo entre familiares y amigas. Existen diferentes actividades dentro el grupo como ser;  venta de fruta, cosméticos, comida rápida (salchipapas y hamburguesas), otras de ellas son panaderas y también confeccionan colchones y almohadas de lana. Este grupo necesita comprar materia prima y mercadería para iniciar sus negocios ya que es una asociación nueva en la institución de Pro-Mujer.
texts.en:
The association “Retamas” belongs to the center Villa Adela; to date the association is composed of twelve members. The president and founder Viviana I. formed the group with family members and friends. The members run different businesses within their group, such as: the sale of fruit, cosmetics, and fast food (Salchipapas- a dish that usually consists of hot dogs or sausages served with French fries, and hamburgers), some are bakers, while others make wool mattresses and pillows. This group needs to purchase basic materials and merchandise to start their businesses given that they are a new association within the Pro-Mujer institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials or merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For expanding businesses

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97764&_tpos=f&_tpg=h

Luisa is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has three adult children who work. Luisa continues to bring footwear and clothes from Trujillo, in the north of Peru. She only brings orders she has received in Lima. The construction of her house has been successfully finished. However, she still needs to put some finishing touches on it. She rents out part of her house while she lives in the other part with her family. Luisa needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy leather shoes and sandals. Her dream is to have a stand to sell shoes.

loans.use: To buy leather shoes and sandals

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle E. is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Rochelle is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rochelle owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a nipa hut making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling nipa hut to local businesses and community members. Rochelle has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rochelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rochelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rochelle is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rochelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Thanh T. D. was born in 1970. ( id: 010107070016). She lives in Xuan Trach village, Xuan Canh commune, Dong Anh distric, Ha Noi city. She has 2 children. They are still going to school. She is farming and breeding chicken. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She is verry happy when she gets loans from Microfund organization. This time, she wants to borrow 225 USD to buy more chicken to raise.
 N. T. N. was born in 1977. ( id: 010107070061). She is a worker. She has 2 children. She has got loans from Microfund organization for 3 years and repaid them on time. She wants to borrow 300 USD to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to raise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 59 years old. Gloria is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates rice retailing business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice & corn products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2004, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:\n\nPaglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of rice and corn & provide working capital

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en la comunidad nativa Vista Alegre en la ciudad de Iparia, región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Elisa  es costurera y también se dedica a la venta de gaseosas,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es profesor. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Yabi II” desde hace nueve años,  el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 que lo invirtió en gaseosas, pues antes se dedicaba a este negocio.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado, una parte para comprar telas, botones, hilos, elásticos, para la confección de trajes típicos y otra parte será invertido en la compra de bebidas ya que piensa retomar este negocio. La meta de Elisa es tener un taller de costura bien implementado para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elisa is a hard-working and active woman. She lives in the Vista Alegre community of Iparia City, in the Ucayali region. She is 36 years old and has two young children. Elisa is a seamstress and she also sells soda pop. Her husband works as a professor. She has been a member of the “Yabi II” Communal Bank for 9 years. Her first loan for 300 soles was invested in soda pop as this was her business previously. Today she needs a loan for 1000 soles which will be used, in part, to buy fabric, buttons, thread, elastic to make traditional clothing and the other part will be used in buying beverages as she is thinking of getting back into that business. Elisa’s goal is to have a well-run seamstress shop to continue attending to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her seamstress business and beverages

loans.name: Fikry

texts.en:
Fikry is a young Palestinian man living in Biet Leed village next to Tulkarem. He is married with three children. He has special needs so he uses a wheelchair to move around. 

Fikry owns an Internet Café and he also fixes computers. He has requested 3,000 USD to bring more computers to his café. He appears in the photo at his store where he fixes computers.

loans.use: To bring more computers to his café

location.town: Biet Leed, Tulkarem City, West Bank

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. is 34 years old, married and has six children. Her husband is a home guard, and her children go to school.

Agnes is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread. She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy more baking flour so she can make more bread. With extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

About BRAC (Bangladesh Rural Advancement Committee):

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, targeted towards war refugees returning to their native home, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more flour for her bread-making business.

loans.name: Boun

texts.en:
Mrs. Boun R., age 51, is a good mother caring for five kids. Two of her children are already married and have started new homes and the others are single. Boun R. has a store on the street where she and her husband sell a variety of desserts to passers-by. She normally starts selling her items in the evening and finishes in the middle of the night. She is generating approximately $6 income per day to help solve her family’s problems. Boun R. will be used her first loan to purchase a vehicle for transportation. She proposes to spend any remainder on enlarging her business. 
Boun R. was busy buying her ingredients at the market when the photo was taken so her husband appears in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to use as transportation

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata B. est une femme mariée de 33 et mère de 5 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et ses enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus de toutes sortes sans réussite. Finalement elle opte pour l’achat  vente de produits céréaliers. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son époux. Elle mène son activité au marché de Torakabougou de Bougouni. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, elle maîttise bien son activité.
Pour agrandir son entreprise, elle décida d’intégrer le progamme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son deuxième prêt pour acheter des sacs de céréales. Le prêt prècedent a été correctement remboursé.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni ville et dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs.
La vente de ses articles se fait au marché de Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni à des revendeurs et aux consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata B. is a 33 year old married woman and mother to 5 children. She lives with her husband and children in a monogamous family in the Torakabougou quarter of the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having left school early, she began various types of money making ventures without much success. Finally she opted to buy and sell cereals. She learned this business from her husband. She runs her business in the Torakabougou market in Bougouni. With 5 years' experience, she is good at her job. In order to grow her business she decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme. This is her second loan from them to buy sacks of cereals. The last loan was correctly repaid. She buys her produce in Bougouni town and in the surrounding villages from the producers. She sells her goods at the Torakabougou market in the town of Bougouni to retailers and consumers. With this loan she plans on earning a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA that will serve to pay the interest due on the loan and provide for the family.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jesus Está Aquí Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group, Jesus Está Aquí (Jesus is here), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums in the north of Santo Domingo, where crime is rampant and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and seven dependents (nephews who have been orphaned).

Isabel is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling fried food by purchasing rice, spaghetti, beef, chicken, sausage and pork. She will use the profits to save for the continued needs of caring for the her newly enlarged family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchasing rice, spaghetti, beef, chicken, sausage and pork for making food to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou V. is from the city of San Fermin Cauayan, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Marilou is married and has 1 adult child. Marilou owns and operates a furniture shop. She has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
