Stanley M. T. is forty-six years old, married, and has three children aged between twenty-two and ten years old. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. His business is located at Hazina Estate in Nairobi and it is well-known by the name 'El Shodai'. He has been selling electrical wires, bulb holders, extension cables, etc., to the local people. He has been doing this business for ten years now and has one employee. 

Stanley says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is harrassment from the local authorities. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more stock for his business. He is a visionary man.

loans.use: Electrical wires, bulb holders, extension cables, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very enthusiastic lady. She has a quality of achieving its dreams. She deals with cloth selling business. With the earning she has able to purchase the bed set which is showing in this picture. 

Her husband name is G. H. who says that Nasreen is a lady who always prefers to do the things first for the betterment of her family than she thinks of herself. He has a leather selling business. He sells the leather in factories and generates earning. 

Presently, her husband needs of a loan of worth Pak Rs. 25,000 to complete the orders otherwise he might lose his customers. 

Nasreen has three other members in her loan group. Rukhsana wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes business. Sajida kosar wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sakina wants a loan to buy material (leather, glue and nails) for her shoe making business.

loans.use: To buy leather to complete the order

loans.name: Westly

texts.en:
Westly J. is 39 years old and a widow with three children who go to school. She has a shop selling items including charcoal, sugar, and salt. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Bags of charcoal, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, soltero y padre a la vez, tiene una hija, Camila de 6 años, quien él vela por su bienestar. Tras la separación de su conviviente, se hizo cargo de su pequeña hija, a quien le dedica todo el día, además cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y sobrino que la ayudan a criarla. 
Es así que toda la noche trabaja de taxista, siendo su horario a partir de las 7.00PM hasta las 7.00AM, horario que le permite estar al pendiente de la educación de su hija. Tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad, y lo hace con el afán de darle un mejor porvenir a su hija. Actualmente ha incursionado en un nuevo negocio, que es la ferretería, por lo que tiene 4 meses que se unió en sociedad con su hermano, y se muestra muy animado y con muchas ganas de progresar. solo espera que este nuevo proyecto le sea rentable y autosostenible, ya que tiene la ventaja de ser el único que ofrezca este servicio. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser responsable como en las anteriores ocasiones, puesto que es el principal valor que le inculcaron desde niño. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más tubos y fierros de diversos números,  para que de ese modo brinde diversidad de accesorios en su ferretería.
texts.en:
Juan, 51, is a very hard-working man. He’s both single and a father; he has a 6-year-old daughter, Camila, whose wellbeing he watches over. After separating from his partner he took over caring for his daughter and he dedicates all day to her; he also counts on his sister and nephew to help raise her. He works all night, from 7pm until 7am as a taxi driver; this schedule allows him to be watchful of his daughter’s education. He has been in this line of work for 20 years and he does it aiming at providing a better future for his daughter. Currently, he has made inroads into a new line of work: hardware. Four months ago he partnered with his brother and is very enthusiastic about this new venture hoping to progress with it. He only hopes that it will be profitable and self-sustaining because he has the advantage of being the only one offering this kind of service. This is his 15th loan with MFP and he commits to being as responsible now as he’s been with past loans because this is the main value he learned as a child. He will use the requested funds to buy assorted metal for his hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted metal.

loans.name: Magi

texts.en:
Magi F. sells bread and tea on the street in the evenings.  She is requesting a loan to buy stock of tins of milk and bags of sugar for her tea.  Magi is 30 years old and is married; her husband is an engineer. She has 3 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy stock of milk and sugar to make tea to sell

loans.name: Shamsiyakhon

texts.en:
R. Shamsiyakhon is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children. For the last 5 years she has been working in a beauty salon. In the salon she provides various services including hair styling, hair cutting, manicure, and the services of a cosmetologist. Her business is successful and generates a stable income for her family. Now Shamsiyakhon is planning to purchase cosmetology and other accessories for her beauty salon. Fror this purpose she is requesting a loan of $1700 US Dollars. Shamsiyakhon thanks all those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase accessories for cosmetology in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Vanney's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who are villagers in Boeng Leu village in the Kandal province. Mrs. Vanney M. is the group leader selected by the other members, all of whom will use the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. She and her husband Mr. Kham Chhean are farmers and own more than a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow crops to sell to support their family. 

Now she has some problems because her field has infertile soil and is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Vanney M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. 

She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou D. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de SAMBA 15 ans 1 depuis le 25 janvier 2003 et a bénéficié 14 fois de suite de crédit qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce au marché centre de son quartier où elle vend des condiments pour cuisine et des produits halieutiques. Avec son prêt actuel elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises, c'est-à-dire des poissons fumés et/ou séchés, du poivre, des oignons, du piment et des ingrédients de cuisine. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille par exemple la santé, la nourriture, l'habillement et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Oumou D. is a 44-year-old married mother of four dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SAMBA 15 ANS1 since January 2003 and has received credit 14 times. She has always repaid her loans without difficulty. She runs a small business in the central market of her neighborhood where she sells cooking condiments and fish products. With this loan she will increase her supply of goods, specifically smoked and/or dried fish, pepper, onions, chillis, and cooking ingredients. She participates in the care of the family--health, food, clothing, and the children's education.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina se dedica a la venta de gelatina, marcianos y algunos productos de confitería hace varios años y lo hace ambulatoriamente en frente de una losa deportiva en donde cada tarde juegan vóleibol muchas vecinas de su comunidad. Con las ganancias que obtiene puede hacerse cargo de los gastos familiares. Felizmente tiene el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como cobrador de combi  a Cristina le gustaría mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene 3 hijos que mantener pero, nuestra socia es muy optimista ya que vende en lozas deportivas y en cualquier evento que se le presente. Ella está muy agradecida a todos los prestamistas por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Cristina has been selling gelatin, popsicles, and some candy products for several years. She sells as a street vendor in front of the sports grounds where many of her neighbors play volleyball every afternoon. With her earnings she is able to take care of the family expenses. Happily, she has her husband’s support. He works as fare collector on a minibus. Cristina would like to improve her income because she has three children to support. Our member is very optimistic because she sells at the sports grounds and at whatever event that comes up. She is very grateful to all of the lenders for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Eva Virginia

texts.es: La señora Eva Virginia Sánchez  tiene 53 años de edad y es viuda, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos lácteos y cosméticos en el mercado de San Raymundo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella solicita este crédito porque quiere agrandar su negocio, ya que casi no tiene competencia y  ya la gente del pueblo la conoce, por lo que le piden sus productos.  Por lo que ella cuenta que necesita el capital para poder tener mejor surtido y poder cumplir con lo que sus clientes le piden.  Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable en FAPE  y agradece el apoyo que  le brinda La señora Eva Virginia Sánchez  tiene 53 años de edad y es viuda, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos lácteos y cosméticos en el mercado de San Raymundo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella solicita este crédito porque quiere agrandar su negocio, ya que casi no tiene competencia y  ya la gente del pueblo la conoce, por lo que le piden sus productos.  Por lo que ella cuenta que necesita el capital para poder tener mejor surtido y poder cumplir con lo que sus clientes le piden.  Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable en FAPE  y agradece el apoyo que se le brinda KIVA.
texts.en:
Eva Virginia Sánchez is a 53 year old widow. She has a business selling dairy products and cosmetics in the San Raymundo market. She is a very hard-working woman. She is requesting this loan because she wants to expand her business. She has almost no competition. The people in the town know her, and they ask for her products. She says that she needs capital to be able to better stock her business and to fill her customers’ orders. She has shown herself to be a responsible woman in FAPE, and she is grateful for Kiva’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business with more products

loans.name: William Kabaka

texts.en:
William Kabaka K. is 31 years old. He is a farmer and supports five people in his family. His spouse is Nolari Kabaka and they have two children aged five years and one years old.  Nolari is a housewife and she helps William in his farming activity.

William has been doing wheat farming for the last eight years. This will be his first loan and he is planning to use it to prepare his five-acre farm for planting. He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by renting a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production. His hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer owning a bigger piece of land and be financially stable to support his family. 

He is hardworking and optimistic towards achieving his set target.

loans.use: To prepare his farm for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for his masks.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: dovi est une femme de 62 ans , qui est très dynamique, elle est veuve. l'activité qu'elle exerce pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens est le commerce de bois servant à fabriquer le cure dents. elle a commencé ce commerce en  1984. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit qui lui servira à acheter 16 bois pour fabriquer et vendre des cures dents.
texts.en:
Dovi is a 62-year old widow who is very dynamic. In order to provide for her daily needs she trades in wood which is used to make toothpicks. She began this business in 1984. Her customer base is made up of all types of people. She is requesting a first loan from WAGES which she will use to buy 16 pieces of wood to make into toothpicks and sell.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Ovi

texts.es: Ovi, de 29 años, convive con Ángel, de 33 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que quieren y cuidan con  mucho amor en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Patay. Como cada mañana se levanta temprano para preparar el desayuno de hijos que van a la escuela, y el resto del día lo dedica a cuidar su terreno de cultivo; desde muy niña le enseñaron a cultivar y trabajar la tierra, “la agricultura es parte de mi”, afirma.  Hace ya 6 años que adquirió su propio terreno de cultivo y ahora tiene mayor capital para poder invertirlo en la compra de más semillas y así obtener mayores ganancias. Ella se dedica a la siembra de arveja, papa y gladiolos, dentro de dos meses cosechará  dos hectáreas de arvejas y ya tiene compradores en el mercado central de su localidad; la calidad de sus verduras le brinda mayor demanda y mayores ganancias. Dentro de unos años podrá adquirir un terreno y así construirá su casa propia. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y resalta la capacidad de ahorro de su banco comunal, en el que se siente feliz y realizada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono para enriquecer los cultivos de arveja que ya muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Ovi is 29 years old and lives with her partner Angel, who is 33. They have 3 young children, who they love and care for with great affection. They live in a rented house in the town of Patay.  

Every morning, Ovi wakes up early to fix breakfast for her children, who are in school. She spends the rest of the day caring for the fields where she grows food. Ever since she was a little girl she has learned to work the land - "agriculture is part of who I am", she says. She got her own land to cultivate some six years ago and now she has enough money to invest in the purchase of more seeds, in order to increase its profitability. 

Ovi grows peas, potatoes and gladiolus. In two months she will harvest two hectares [almost 5 acres] of peas, and she already has buyers in the town's central market. The high quality of her vegetables has meant high demand and more profits. In a few years she will be able to acquire more land and build her own house. 

This is Ovi's fourth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner], and the communal bank that she belongs to has a very high level of savings. She feels both happy and accomplished as a part of this communal bank. Ovi will use the current loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the pea fields that she will soon harvest.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya M. is a 50 year old widow and mother of 6 children. She sales ice blocks as well as charcoa to earn herincome from Malindi town dwellers where her businesses are situated. This is the third time that Zakiya has taken a loan from KADET LTD and it is of Kshs. 50,000. She plans to use the money to expand her nine year old businesses by increasing her stock of charcoal and buying a modern freezer for her ice business.
The lady was introduced to KADET LTD by another client from the company and wishes to use the anticipated profit from her business to help educate her children and further expand her ever growing businesses.

loans.use: To expand the business by adding more supplies of charcoal and  buy  a modern freezer

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced and lives in Kherson, southern Ukraine, with her daughter and a disabled son. She sells women’s outer clothing in one of the local markets called Dneprovskyi. The location of her vending kiosk is very favorable as it’s in a busy place.

Valentina has been in this trade for 15 years and has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Presently, she has about 40,000 Grivnas worth of inventory. Her net income is about 5,000 Grivnas per month.

Valentina would like to borrow 14,700 Grivnas to increase the variety of inventory in her kiosk and to keep her business running successfully this fall season. She believes that the loan will assist her in her entrepreneurial endeavors and help her to succeed.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory

loans.name: Analda Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Analda se dedica al comercio, vende tajadas de platano fritas, su negocio se mantiene estable y sus condiciones de vida se ve que son favorables. 
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable ya que su micro empresa hace uso de dos empleados de diferente sexo, la de sexo femenino le ayuda en todo el proceso de la elaboración de las tajaditas y el hombre es el que se encarga de hacer las compras y la distribución de las mismas.
sus clientes potenciales son los dueños de las casetas de diferentes de centros educativos de la ciudad de Danlí a quienes les vende el producto y muchos ya están por encargos.
Doña Analda es una mujer soltera y que con su trabajo cubre todos los gastos familiares.
con ella vive un hijo y la esposa de su hijo, pero él ya no depende de ella porque trabaja para mantener su nueva familia, de Doña Analda ya solo depende su Madre quien es una señora ya de edad bien avanzada y que esta a un 100% al cargo de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de platanos, aceite y sal.
texts.en:
Analda is a merchant. She sells fried plantain. Her business is stable and her quality of life is good. 
 
The growth of her business is notable, since her micro-business has two employees, a man and a woman. The woman helps her in the process of preparing the plantains and the man takes care of purchasing and distribution.  

Her potential customers are the owners of different stands near the educational centers in the city of Danlí. She sells them her product and a lot of it is made to order.  

Analda is a single woman who with her work covers all of the family expenses. She lives with her son and his wife. He doesn't depend depend on her, because he works to support his new family. The only person who depends on Analda is her mother, who is an elderly woman and who is 100% under her care. She will use the loan to buy plantains, oil, and salt.

loans.use: To buy plantains, oil, salt and wrappers.

loans.name: Sop Sa Diekeur Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SA DIEKEUR est créé o l'ouverture du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite (FOGNY2) Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité.

Madame Absa T., à debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petite sœur. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux, de tissus et parfums. Elle fait cette activité depuis bientôt 4 ans

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter sa marchandise afin accroitre son chiffre d'affaire

Elle participe à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne. Et prend en charge également ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The Sop Sa Diekeur solidarity group has been created at the opening of the Bank Villageois (Fogny2) to which it belongs. The group is composed of 13 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. 

Mrs. Absa T., standing on the far left in the photo raising her hand, is the group’s leader. She is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of three. She also has her younger sister in her care.

She sells jewelry, fabrics, and perfums. She has been in this business for almost four years already. With her new loan, she is going to increase her merchandise stock in order to boost her revenues. She contributes to the everyday family expenses and also provides for her own personal needs.

loans.use: Purchasing jewelry, fabrics and perfumes

loans.name: Kision

texts.en: Kision is a thirty-one-year-old married man with five children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for two and a half years,  and this has helped him to educate his children. His business dream is to own a wholesale shop in the next four years. Kision needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, soap and sodas for sale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, salt and sodas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sheep, pigs, and a donkey

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s tea stall business. Her husband’s tea stall is located in the market from where he offers his clients different flavors of tea such as green, creamy, and milky and black.  
His tea is very famous among his customers. He is doing this business for over 10 years and very well known in the region for his good quality services. With the loan, he will buy green tea, black tea, sugar and milk. 
Razia herself is a housewife, spends most of her time in doing her household responsibilities. She has four sons who are all very young and stays at home. Razia couldn’t provide them education facilities due to poor financial conditions. 
Now she is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husbands’ business will get improved and she will be able to send her youngest son to school. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record by paying her installments on time and by attending all the recovery meetings. 
She belongs to Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. 
Note: "In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy green tea, black tea, sugar and milk for tea stall business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Lilian Z. is married to a meat vendor and has two children, a girl and a boy. She owns and operates a small piggery in their backyard. Also, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells chorizos to her friends and neighbors. Lilian works hard to expand their small business and provide a decent living for her family. Lilian is in need of additional piglets for her piggery. She applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from Kiva partner CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help her expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to grow

loans.name: Adjélévi

texts.fr: Madame Adjélévi est veuve et âgée de 54 ans. Elle a 4 enfants en charge. Elle   est née à Lomé et habite  Abobokomé. Elle fait le commerce de charbons de bois pour s’occuper aux besoins de ses enfants.   Elle est dans son deuxième cycle de prêt.  Elle s’approvisionne à Notsè et revend à Abobokomé à Lomé. Elle a commencé ces activités en 2003. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Madam Adjélévi A. D. is a 54-year-old widow in charge of 4 children. She was born in Lomé and lives in Abobokomé. She started selling charcoal in 2003 to be able to take care of her children. She is in her second loan cycle. She gets her supplies in Nostè and sells the charcoal in Abobokomé in Lomé. She is applying for loan with WAGES to buy 20 charcoal bags.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny G. is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old. Leny is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing general services to local community members. Leny has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Leny is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hellen Penina

texts.en:
Hellen penina N. is 23 years-old and the married mother of two children. Hellen is a farmer and, four the last four years, she has farmed on her own piece of land.

She learned about Kiva partner KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan and she plans to spend it to buy farm supplies and to purchase livestock for fattening. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Hellen's dream is to educate her children to a higher level and expand her farming.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and purchase livestock for fattening

loans.name: Ranohon's Group

texts.en:
Ranohon M., 48, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Aravan.  Unfortunately she is a widow. She has five children; two older sons work in construction, a third son who studies at school, and two daughters who help their mom with housework. In 1996 when the collective farms broke up, Ranohon got a piece of land and started to cultivate agricultural products.  She is also engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers. In the future Ranohon wants to see her children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa América

texts.es: Rosa América C. B. de 47 años de edad habita  en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes hasta la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Como toda mujer trabajadora y luchadora Doña Rosa ha logrado establecer una tienda, a través de la que suministra productos de primera necesidad, establecida en su misma casa en el Municipio de San Juan Opico del Departamento de La Libertad. Ella trabaja de lleno en su tienda para poder atender a sus clientes cuando necesiten de sus productos como: golosinas, pan dulce, azúcar, macarrones, aceite, juguetes, bebidas, productos de limpieza, entre otros. Depende mucho de su negocio y tiene muchas aspiraciones con las ventas que realiza. Por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para invertirlo en su tienda y poder comprar mayor variedad de productos e innovar su negocio como: cereales, aceite, papel, leche, café, golosinas, y de mas productos que le permitan mejorar su servicio. Ya que como toda mujer emprendedora sabe que debe estar al día con las demandas del mercado. Con esto espera poder obtener los recursos necesarios para vivir en mejores condiciones junto con su familia.
texts.en: Rosa América C. B. is 47 years old and she lives in her own house with two children who are in school. Like a hardworking and courageous woman, Doña Rosa has managed to establish a store where she sells basic products. The store is located in her house in the municipality of San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad. Rosa works full time in the store to be able to attend to her customers when the need one of her products like: candy, sweet bread, sugar, macaroni, oil, toys drinks, and cleaning products, among others. She depends very much on her business and has many aspirations for the sales that she makes. This is why she has decided to request a loan, to invest in her store and to be able to buy a greater variety of products and to innovate within her business with products like: cereal, oil, paper, milk, coffee and candy and other products that allow her to improve the service she provides. Because like all entreprenuerial women she knows that she has to keep up with the demands of the market. With this she hopes to obtain the necessary resources to live in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: To buy cereal, oil, paper, milk, coffee, and a variety of candy

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Konstantin

texts.en:
Konstantin G. comes from the village of Sanebeli, Kareli district. He is 42 years old and lives with his wife Leila, two daughters (5 and 2 years old) and his parents (retired). 

The family’s total monthly income amounts to 800 Laris, approximately 40% of which comes from the parents’ pensions and government monthly social assistance given to the family, as they are regarded as living under the poverty line. The rest of the income comes from agricultural activities: Konstantin and Leila have two cows and their dairy products are sold locally. Also the family owns 1.85 ha of agricultural land, where maize, wheat, haricot beans, potatoes and apple trees are grown. Part of the harvested fruits and vegetables are consumed within the family and another part is sold on the local market. Also Konstantin has 4 oxen. He uses them for transportation of wood from the forest. The wood is sold in the village. 

With the requested loan Konstantin plans to purchase seeds for maize, haricot beans and potatoes, fertilizers and pay for tilling the land.  Using these materials he will be able to cultivate his land and sow the grains and vegetables. Konstantin and Leila hope that they will have a good harvest season and the received income will be enough to perform some renovation work in their house.

loans.use: to pay for land tilling service and purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio B. is from the village of Gubaan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 60 years old. Rogelio is married and has eight adult children. Rogelio owns and operates a rice farm. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. He has successfully repaid his last loan from GDMPC, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

This loan will be his second from GDMPC. Rogelio is requesting 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor for farm maintenance. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost for farm maintenance

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Irene. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de refrescos, venta de queso, elaboración de todo tipo de costura, construcción, venta de ropa interior, profesora, taxista, elaboración de calzados.
 
La señora Irene,  indica que hace un año y seis meses que compone Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de su hija. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior, que viene trabajando desde que inicio en nuestra institución, ya que anteriormente tenía otro negocio, pero su hermana le informó del trabajo con esta mercadería.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de ropa interior), este material lo compra de la cuidad de la calle Tumusla (calle comercial de la ciudad de La paz) y los venderá de forma ambulante tres veces a la semana. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los demás servicios y la metodología.

En la fotografía no parase la señora Silvia, por razones culturales
texts.en:
The group "A.C. Sartasinani" will start its 4th loan cycle with Pro Mujuer.  This group is meets in the Villa Exaltacion central office of Pro Mujer, and is made up of 8 members.  The group is led by its board of directors, which is headed by Irene.  The members of this group have a variety of different businesses, including: the sale of soft drinks, the sale of cheese, dressmaking, construction, the sale of undergarments, and shoe production.  The group also includes a teacher and a taxi driver.  

Irene tells us that it's been a year and a half since she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of her daughter.  Now she has a business selling undergarments that she has been working in since she started with our institution.  Previously, she had a different business, but her daughter suggested that she work with this type of merchandise.

The loan that she will get now will be used to increase her merchandise (to buy undergarments.)  She will buy this merchandise on Tumusla street (a commercial street in the city of La Paz), and she will sell the merchandise in an itinerant manner 3 days a week.  This type of work will allow her to generate resources to help support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has 7 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the services and the methodologies of the institution.  

In the photograph the member Silvia is not seen for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Perlinda

texts.en: Perlinda. a 43-year-old married mother of one child who is in school, has been farming rice in the Philippines for the past six years. She is now requesting her eighth loan for PHP 15,000  through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Perlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Ils ont un enfant. 
Kokou a travaillé comme revendeur depuis 2001. Il achète et vend des portable au port autonome. Il achète les portables au Nigeria aussi. 
Kokou a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du stock de portables.
texts.en:
Kokou is a man of 34. He is married to a seamstress. They have one child. Kokou has worked selling goods since 2001. He buys and resells cell phones at the Port in his town. He also buys cell phones in Nigeria. 
 
Kokou has requested his second loan from WAGES to stock up on cell phones.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 53 years old and married with five children. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for three years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Irene has borrowed and repaid seventeen loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Irene works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Believe Group

texts.en:
Abdallah, who is in his late twenties, is married with one small child.  He has been selling secondhand clothes for six months now.  He works from 5am to 7pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more secondhand clothes to sell.  His dream is to one day build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Believe", which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jose tiene 32 años esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos.  Vive con su familia en casa propia ubicada en una comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo del distrito de Morrope. Jose goza de buenas referencias personales.

La actividad que realiza,  es la crianza y venta de animales menores ( cuyes, patos, pavos) a las personas de su comunidad y alrededores. Se dedica a ello desde hace más de 10 años y cuenta con clientela establecida y gran experiencia en su negocio.

Jose solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más cuyes y aves de corral, así como ,el alimento balanceado que la crianza de estos requiere. Su objetivo es incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos para poder darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Jose tiene muchos deseos de superación y estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
José, 32, is married and is the father of four children.  He lives with his family in his own house located in a rural community that’s in the midst of developing in Mórrope District.   José has good personal references.

His activity is raising small farm animals (guinea pigs, ducks and turkeys) to sell to people in the community and adjacent areas.  He’s been in this line of work for over 10 years and has a well established customer base and quite a bit of business experience.

José is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more guinea pigs and barnyard fowl as well as the nutritionally balanced feed their care requires.  His goal is to increase sales and income to provide his family with better quality of life.

José very much wants to improve and would be very grateful if the loan were granted because it will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Ouassa

texts.fr:
Madame Ouassa est une femme mariée de 23 ans et mère de 1 enfant  Elle vit avec son enfant chez son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.(région de Sikasso).
Madame Ouassa est une diplômée en Secrétariat de Direction. Après ses études elle est restée pendant des années sans emploi. Ainsi pour subvenir à ses besoins tout en aidant son époux dans les dépenses de la famille, elle décide de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi que souvent elle accompagnait son amie dans ses activités commerciales  afin d’apprendre l’achat et la vente de pagnes. Avec 5 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité et est très sollicitée.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, elle décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Ouassa compte acheter avec son prêt,  12 pièces de pagnes wax, brodés et fancy.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). La vente se fait à la maison et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni en ambulant, au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit payable journalièrement, hebdomadairement ou mensuellement au choix du client. Sa clientèle est composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Avec ce prêt, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de d’améliorer son entreprise et à payer les intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Ouassa is a 23-year old married woman who has one child. She lives with her child and husband in the Torkabougou district of Bougouni (in the Sikasso region).

Ouassa has an executive secretarial diploma but after she completed her studies she was unemployed for some years. In order to provide for her needs and help out her husband with the household expenses, she decided to build up some income generating activity. She thus often helped out her  friend with her business, in order to learn the trade of buying and selling "pagnes". She now has five years' experience in this business, masters it well and is in great demand.

In order to gain a consistent working capital, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. With her loan she is planning to buy 12 pieces of highly decorative, embroidered and "fancy" printed pagnes. She gets her supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). She sells them at home and walking around the various districts of Bougouni, for cash and on a retail basis, but sometimes on credit (the customer can choose to make repayments on a daily, weekly or monthly basis). Her customer base is made up of all types of social classes.

With this loan she is hoping to make a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA, which will allow her to improve her business and pay the interest on her Soro Yiriwaso loan.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (pieces of highly decorative West African fabric)

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 58 years of age. She is married and has five children. Three of them are married already and two are still single. She is engaged in a retail shop business where she sells a variety of groceries such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks and ingredients. She is a woman who really enjoys her work and waiting on her customers. She has been earning a living in this business for more than four years and gets up early every day to wait on her customers.

Her greatest dream is to improve her earnings in order to continue providing daily sustenance to her grandchildren and her family. The loan of P10,000 she is seeking will be used to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her retail shop business. She hopes that she can maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, ingredients and shampoo for her retail shop

loans.name: Kosimjon

texts.ru:
Косимчон умный, добрый и ответственный человек. Он женат и у них 3 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается ремонта автомобилей дома. Сегодняшний день, зарабатывая денег, он взял в аренду мастерскую там, где он может привлекать много других новых клиентов. Его бизнес идут хорошо и прибыльно. В день он ремонтирует 2-3 автомобилей и получает хорошую прибыль. Его отец и брат плотник и иногда в свободное время Косимчон помогает им. Косимчон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки запчастей для ремонта автомобилей. Он  хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Kosimjon is a smart, kind and responsible man. He is married and has three children. He has been repairing vehicles for more than ten years. At this time he has rented out a repair shop where he can attract many new customers and make money. His business is going well and brings profit. He repairs two or three vehicles a day and makes a good profit. His father and brother are carpenters and sometimes in his free time Kosimjon helps them. Kosimjon would like to receive a loan in the amount of $1000USD to buy spare parts to repair vehicles. He wants to thank all of you for your help and support in advance.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who is 37 years old.  He is married and blessed with one child. For the last five weeks, he has been managing a taxi transport business to make a living. He also sells clothes. In the next 5 years, he wants to buy another car. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a hardworking businesswoman, 41 and single. For over five years, she has been providing services such as printing and photocopying.  She has retained her business because of her good services.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a photocopier machine.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier machine

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ronalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages on her mini store and at the same time she cooked food like viand and rice for extra income. She has had this business for three years.She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages and to buy ingredients for the menu she will be cooking on  the next days.. 

Ronalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ronalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi is a 27-year-old married man from Gaza who lives with his wife and daughter.  In 2009, Shadi decided that he would like to have his own farm on which he raises sheep. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy more sheep for his farm.  He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and lives happily together with her husband. Her husband is a carpenter. They are blessed with four children. She lives in Cabilinan, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Jocelyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for five years and she has a net income per month of PHP 4,000

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. She joined GDMPC this October 2011.

Jocelyn hopes and prays that her business project will progress and be productive because she plans that if it has a good return, she will buy a mother pig.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Finda Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,500,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for repaying the loan on their behalf.

Finda is the leader of this group of teachers. The 53-year-old was born in Yengema, in Eastern Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children who are in secondary school. Finda has served in the teaching profession for 32 years. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children, repair her house and invest the rest in business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children, repair her house and invest the rest in business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas, tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de 05 hijos; viven en su casa propia. Ella desea brindarles apoyo y un buen futuro a sus hijos. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la elaboración de ladrillos, Felicitas es campesina a mucha honrra ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos. Viene trabajando 12 años en la elaboración y venta de ladrillos, de los cuales necesita el apoyo de jornaleros que contrata para avanzar rápidamente y entregar a tiempo el trabajo a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo elaborar y entregar puntual los pedidos de ladrillo; ya que así siente más tranquila de no perder clientes. Considera que lo más difícil es en tiempos de lluvia ya que no puede trabajar muy bien. Con el tiempo piensa comprar más tierra especial a un precio cómodo para la elaboración de ladrillo. Este será su préstamo número 12 con MFP y está muy contenta al saber que una vez más contará con el apoyo financiero. Le agrada trabajar con sus compañeros de su banco comunal ya que son personas responsables. Con el crédito solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará tierras para la elaboración de su ladrillo.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 32, is a single mother with five children and they all live in her house.  She hopes to support and provide a better future for her children. From an early age, her parents taught her how to make bricks. Felicitas is a countrywoman and very proud of it because she's both mother and father to her children. 

She has been making and selling bricks for 12 years. She needs the support of hired laborers to maintain her schedule and deliver the work on time to her clients. What she enjoys most about her work is to make bricks and provide timely deliveries of her work. This gives her peace of mind by not losing clients. She considers it the hardest to work well in the rainy season. In the future, she hopes to buy more clay at a reasonable price for brick-making. 

This will be her 12th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP). She's very happy to know that she can once again count with financial support. She likes working with her colleagues from the communal bank since they are responsible. With this loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will buy clay for brick-making.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Cухроб живет вместе с женой и тремя детьми. Его мать также живут с ними.  Жена домохозяйка, а он сам кормит свою семью зарабатывая своим ремеслом. Он плотник. Он занимается производством и продажей окон и дверей. Он начал свою деятельность в 2008 году и вложил все свои силы и усилия. Раньше он продавал продукты питания. Он хочет получить займ и использовать целенаправленно. Он планирует использовать займ для покупки древесины на производство окон и дверей.
texts.en: Suhrob lives with his wife and three children. his elderly mother also lives with them. Suhrob's wife is a home maker, and he himself provides for the family with his woodworking business. Suhrob primarily makes doors and windows for sale. He started his woodworking business back in 2008 and put all of his money and strength in helping it take off. Before he was a woodworker Suhrob sold groceries. He is hoping to use this loan to purchase a large batch of wood whole sale so that he can make additional doors and windows for a better profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase of wood for windows and doors

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.en:
Nemesio is a married and has four children. He is 52 years old and he resides at Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living, and he has been 10 years in this business. Each month, he earns approximately 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Nemesio requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2005, he joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda de 39 años de edad, convive con Alfonso con quien tiene 6 hijos pero vive con 5 de ellos, la menor tiene 7 años. Está familia habita un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa de San Román Bajo, en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Hermelinda es una mujer que predica con el ejemplo. Trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Con la ayuda de Alfonso se dedican a la agricultura. Siembran principalmente café en sus 3 lotes de terrenos. “El café es más rentable que cualquier otro producto, el kilo lo vendo a 12 soles”, comenta. 
Y como ya lleva mucho tiempo en esta actividad está asociada a una cooperativa, la que recibe su producción al instante. Para que los granos sean buenos, ella tiene que invertir en abonos constantemente y los cuidados como son: el macheteo, el cultivo, la limpieza de las hojas de las arañas, el podo, etc. En esa labor la ayudan sus hijos y su esposo. Pero la época de cosecha es más intensa por eso contrata personal adicional, a quien paga diariamente. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Hermelinda obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “La Bella Durmiente”, del que se muestra esperanzada.
De obtener el dinero podrá invertir en la compra de bolsas de abonos y para pagar a los jornaleros quienes trasplantarán el café en otras tierras.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, age 39, lives with Alfonso, with whom she has 6 children; however, she lives with only 5 of them, the youngest of whom is 7 years old. This family owns a house in their hometown of San Román Bajo, in the district of Perené of the Chanchamayo province. Hermelinda is a woman who practices what she preaches. She works very hard in order to help her family get ahead. With Alfonso's help, she works in agriculture. They mainly grow coffee beans in their 3 plots. "Coffee is more lucrative than any other crop. I sell the kilo at 12 PEN," she comments.

Since she has been in agriculture for a long time, she belongs to a cooperative, which instantly receives her crops. In order to get good beans, she needs to constantly invest in fertilizer, and to perform tasks such as: cutting, cultivating, pruning, cleaning the leaves and getting rid of the spiders, etc. Her children and husband help her with these duties. However, the harvest is the most intense period, which is why she hires additional help whom she pays daily. This will be Hermelinda's first loan from MFP, and she feels excited about it. She is now a member of the "La Bella Durmiente" (Sleeping Beauty) communal bank, and she feels hopeful.

Upon receiving the money, she will be able to invest it in purchasing sacks of fertilizer, and in paying the day laborers who will transplant the coffee plants to other fields.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en: Sarorn, 57, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish paste for over six years and is successful in her career. Her oldest daughter is a secondhand clothes vendor. Sarorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase wood for building her house. By doing so, she will have a comfortable house to live in. In the future, she would like to purchase a truck to carry fish paste, as well as clothes to sell. Moreover, she plans to support her children in their studies until they receive a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase wood for building her house.

loans.name: Tophey

texts.en:
Tophey, age 50, is a farmer in Nyimba, Zambia. Tophey has been growing tomato, onion, cabbage and fresh greens to sell to buyers at local markets in Zambia’s Eastern province region. He plans to get a water pump that will help him realize his goals of further expanding his farm.

Last year, Tophey used buckets to draw water from a nearby well and irrigate his crops. This year he is hoping to expand his garden, and increase his profits, while reducing the labour required to provide irrigation.

Rent to Own will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Tophey with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of the business.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en: Gurban is a low income person from Agsu district. He is married has 4 kids. He is 45 years old. He started his business in 1997. In 2005-2007 he borrowed 2 loans from Normicro Agsu branch amounting 300-600$ and used them for business expansion. Now he applies for $1200 to buy more animals and expand the business.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Tusiga

texts.en: Tusiga lives in a small Samoan village with her husband.  Her five children live with her sister in Samoa’s capital because there are better schools there.  Tusiaga works hard to be able to fund her children’s education through her taro sales.  However, there have been many incidents of her crop having been reduced by theft or by wild animals digging it up.  To protect her valuable income (and children’s education funds), Tusiga is seeking loan funds to purchase a barrier fence to enclose her crop.

loans.use: Purchase barrier fence

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Blanca has a grocery store where she also sells stationary supplies. Her store is in her home, in an area very lucrative for these types of sales. She began her business with a $100 loan from a family member.

Loan Use

Blanca will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as office supplies and stationary, because she lives diagonally from a school. She also wishes to improve her business' facade and would like to repaint the exterior and to place a sign that draws more attention.

Personal Information

Blanca is 36, and out of her five children, four go to school. Her home is made of cement and she has a stable family life. She is sure that her business will allow her the opportunity to give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer,Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Blanca tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, viveres y de articulos de papeleria que atiende en su casa donde dispuso unlocal para dicha venta. Este negocio lo inicio con $100 que prestó a un familiar.

Uso del Préstamo

Blanca usará el préstamo para comprar más mercaderia en especial articulos de oficina y papeleria porque ella esta diagonal a una escuela tambien va a acondicionar la fachada de su negocio pues desea pintar y poner un letrero mucho mas llamativo

Información Personal

Blanca tiene 36 años de sus cinco hijos cuatro estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar, ella tiene la seguridad que su negocio le dará la oportunidad de poder educar bien a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise such as office supplies and paper.

loans.name: Semender

texts.en: Semender N. is a 37-year-old farmer who lives in the southern Azerbaijani village of Varkhankend in the Saatrli region. He is married and has four children. Semender has six years of experience in animal breeding. Currently he has only one milk cow, which was purchased a long ago, and Semender himself raised from a small calf. Semender sells yoghurt and milk to the local people and bazaar traders every day. He is working very hard, from early morning till late night. Dairy products are in high demand and increases every day. Keeping one cow is not enough to cover large family needs and Semender would like to borrow 1200 USD to purchase one additional cow and two calves and start selling meat products,.  Meat is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan. The estimated cost for one cow is 700 USD and for a baby calf is 250 USD.  He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Onoiva

texts.en:
Onoiva L. is a mother of 38 years of age, married with 7 children. Her husband is a carpenter and his salary is not sufficient to support the whole family. Onoiva also lives with her parents and she is also supporting them. She is having hard time, but she tries her best to support her family.

Onoiva decided to do something for herself, not only to support her family but to earn money for herself. Onoiva is planning to run a canteen in the village school and to sell more varieties of ice cakes to the children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Linda Vasco

texts.pt:
Linda Vasco M. is 37 years old, she is a single mother of a son. She lives in the neighborhood of Fomento in Matola. She joined the credit program in September 2006 and her first loan was of 3.000MT. When she joined the program she was selling groceries but now she sells clothes and bed linens. She is in the 3rd cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 8.000mt, to be repaid in 8 months. She plans on increasing her inventory.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Linda Vasco M. tem 37 anos de idade, é mãe solteira de um filho.Vive no bairo Fomento na Matola. Entrou para o programa em Setembro de 2006 com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Vende roupa nova e roupa de cama.Quando entrou para o programa vendia produtos alimentares. Vai para o 3º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 7 meses com vista comprar mnais roupa para o seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mr. Lay S., 49, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works as a mechanic repairing car engines and generally makes about US$ 5 each day. His wife, 44, works selling grocery products to the people in her community, making on average US$ 10/day in revenue. Two of their children work with their father as mechanics and the other two are students.

Mr. Lay S. hopes to use this loan to purchase some spare parts for his business and buy more grocery products for his wife to better meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase some spare parts to expand his machine shop

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
ClotilD. belongs to a communal bank in El Breo. She lives in the region of San Martin, in the providence of Mariscal Caceres and the district of Juanjui. She dedicates herself to the selling of products and other groceries. She is situated in Jr. Manco Capac. With the initiative and support from her husband she has succeeded. Now she has more clients than ever before thanks to her good service and competitive prices.

With the loan of 3000 Soles, which she will have to pay back in 6 months, she will buy groceries such as: containers, soap, rice, sugar, milk, paper, oil, and other goodies.

She is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and her 4 children. Her family strongly supports her.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora ClotilD. pertenece al banco comunal El Breo, vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres y distrito D. Juanjui. Se dedica al comercio a la venta D. abarrotes y el negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Manco Cápac Nº 417. Con la iniciativa y apoyo D. su esposo ha salido adelante, logrando incrementar su negocio, ya que antes era pequeño y ahora tiene más clientela por su buen trato al cliente y sus precios competitivos.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000 el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas D. jabón, lava vajillas, lejía D. diferentes marcas (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), etc., sacos D. 50 kilogramos D. azúcar y arroz, leche gloria en cajas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas D. pescado, aceite por litros, fideos en paquetes.

La señora ClotilD. tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes diariamente la apoyan demostrando que cuando la familia está unida no hay límites y se pueden cumplir metas con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods (sugar, rice, milk, oil, etc)

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es:
Bismark is 29 years old and single. He learned how to cultivate local crops from his father when he was 15 years old. At his young age, he has two plots of good quality, productive land which he works. March and April are the best months for planting, and Bismark is able to get two harvests during the year. He needs a loan to buy more organic materials needed for the cultivation and harvesting process. With the income he generates he can pay his costs, as well as help his parents financially. His most important goal is to build a better home for his parents where they can live a tranquil and safe life. The earnings from this harvest will give him the opportunity to begin making these improvements if the harvest is of the quality he expects. The money he is requesting will help guarantee a high quality harvest.

Bismarck tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, aprendió de su padre a cultivar pitahaya, actividad que adquirió hace 15 años y a la cual hoy en día se dedica, a su corta edad posee 2 manzanas de tierras en donde tiene plantadas vainas de pitahaya, cultivo que le ha permitido desarrollarse adecuadamente debido a las características ambientales que presenta la zona. En el verano (Marzo-Abril), es la época donde se asienta de mejor manera el cultivo, ya que necesitan de estar expuestas a los rayos del sol, requieren de riego constante pero teniendo en cuenta que el exceso de humedad perjudica el suelo, al año el joven saca dos producciones de pitahaya, ya sea en los meses de mayo a agosto o septiembre. El joven requiere de un préstamo para comprar insumos orgánicos que requiere en todo el proceso productivo del cultivo, ya que con los ingresos que genera la producción se paga sus gastos, con su trabajo apoya económicamente a sus padres, el mayor deseo de Bismarck, es el de construirle una mejor vivienda a sus padres en la que puedan vivir su vejez de manera tranquila y segura, por lo que con las ganancias de esta cosecha tendrá la oportunidad de iniciar las mejoras si el producto sale con la calidad esperada, para ello solicita este préstamo para garantizar una buena calidad de la cosecha.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZERS TO HELP GUARANTEE A HIGH QUALITY HARVEST

loans.name: Kilitia

texts.en: Kilita S. is a married 49-year-old. Her husband has had a lawnmowing business for the past 15 years, and he  specializes in offering this service. His experience began at the age of 14 when working for the reverend's family in his village. He got into an accident one day and injured himself badly. From then, their business was having difficulties, so that it nearly closed up. Kilitia then joined SPBD, and that helped her shape up the business into what is it right now. With her requested loan she will be purchasing two new lawnmowers.

loans.use: To purchase 2 new lawn mowers

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. She is married and has a 14 year old son. Natalya sells men’s and women’s knitted wear in the central city market. She has 10 years of experience working in this sphere of business. Her vending location is well equipped and clients like Natalya’s style of service and reasonable prices. Consistency in quality service has promoted her business growth, helping her to build about $1200 in turnover capital and earn about $500 in net profit every month.

Natalya wants to add some stock this spring season, so she has requested a loan of approximately $1025 US. With this additional merchandise, she hopes to generate extra profits and improve her family’s standard of living. She would especially like to buy her son a computer which he’s been longing to have for some time. Natalya proved herself credit worthy when she took her first loan with Nadiya Ukraine in 2004 . We believe her tenacity to pursue her goals will help Natalya to be successful and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Fayzullo S. lives in the Nurek region. He is 46 years old, is married and has 3 children. Fayzullo has been raising livestock for over 15 years. He raises both small and large horned animals. Since it is very hard to find a permanent job in a rural area, this is the main source of income for many families. Fayzullo purchases young livestock at the market, fattens them and resells them for a profit. This business helps him to support his family. Today, the client would like to purchase another calf. This is why he needs money. He has decided to take out a loan for 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафарзод Файзулло житель района Нурек. Возраст 46 лет , женат , имеет 3 детей. Файзулло более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелкий и крупный рогатый скот. Так как в сельской местности очень трудно найти постоянную работу-эта деятельность является основным источником дохода многих семей. Файзулло покупает на рынке молодых сельхоз.животных ,откармливает и продает по более выгодной ему цене. Этот бизнес помогает ему содержать свою семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить очередного бычка. Для чего ему нужны деньги . Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calf

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Antonia del Carmen V. tengo 60 años de edad,  mi actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio, el cual es muy bueno ya que la tortilla es un alimento fundamental en la comida de nuestras comunidades,  esta actividad me genera ingresos para cumplir con los compromisos adquiridos y colaborar con los gastos de mi hogar ya que en mi hogar solo somos mi esposo y yo, y con nuestras edades es dificil conseguir trabajo fijo, necesitamos de su apoyo para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: compra de harina de maiz, leña y cal.

loans.name: Van Tai's Group

texts.vi:
This is the first time Mr. N. Van Tai (ID Number 060035), 45 years old, joins the SEDA Fund. He would like to borrow 2,950,000VND to purchase more rice to seperate the husk from the rice. The rice bran is used as pig feed while Mr. Tai sells off the rice. As a active woM., his wife also helps him a lot in this. He has 2 children working as factory workers and thus, they contribute to the family's income. Mr. Tai really likes to join this Fund because he can repay the loan on an installment basis. His family's average daily income is about 150,000VND (about 9.50USD). His group also consists of:
  • Mrs. M. Thi Hoa (ID Number 060037), borrows 2,242,000VND to purchase wood to make furniture
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hue (ID Number 060036), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase materials to tailor clothes
  • Mrs. N. Thi Minh (ID Number 060039), borrows 2,950,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. M. Thi Luyen (ID Number 060038), borrows 2,950,000VND to purchase more food for her breakfast eatery

    • The total amount requested is 800USD

    Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Chú Nguyễn Văn Tài (MS: 060035), năm nay 45 tuổi. Chú tham gia vay vốn lần đầu tiên. Chú vay 2.950.000 VND về mua thóc xay sát để lấy cám nuôi lợn còn gạo để bán. Vợ anh là người rất năng động giúp anh rất nhiều trong công việc xay sát. Anh có hai con đang đi làm công nhân, cũng giúp gia đình anh có thêm thu nhập. Anh rất thích tham gia chương vay vốn vì được trả dần. Mức thu nhập của gia đình anh là khoảng 150.000 VND.

    Trong nhóm còn có:

  • Chị Mẫn Thị Hòa (MS: 060037), vay 2.242.000 VND để mua gỗ làm bàn ghế.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ (MS: 060036), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua vải may quần áo bán.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh (MS: 060039), vay 2.950.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Luyến (MS: 060038), vay 2.950.000 VND để mua đồ về bán hàng ăn sáng.

loans.use: Buying rice

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
At 37 years of age, Asha is married with three children, aged 13, 6 and 3. She has been selling perfume and shoes since 2002. She works at her business every day, earning a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more perfume and shoes to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes amd shoe to increase her stock

loans.name: Rosa Teonila

texts.es:
