La señora Rosa Teonila V. D. R. tiene 74 años  y vive en la plaza D. armas D. Mache, en la calle San Martín 113 en el distrito D. Mache  en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Curso hasta el primer año D. primaria porque según nos manifiesta en su tiempo los padres decían que las mujeres no deben aprender a leer y a escribir porque les iba a servir para escribir cartas D. amor a los hombres y era mejor que tal sabiduría no la aprendieran.
Tiene negocios múltiples porque debe trabajar D. acuerdo a la época, se queda en su bodega en época D. lluvia y sale a fabricar teja en época D. verano, en el que se venD. muy bien el producto.
Recuerda con alegría cuando recibió el primer préstamo que le brindo Manuela Ramos  y fue D. 300 soles, compró material para ampliar su negocio, lo devolvió en cuatro meses, “Manuela confió en mí porque yo no era objeto D. crédito para otros bancos”, lo manifiesta con una amplia sonrisa.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000 soles que utilizará en ampliar su negocio D. la bodega porque ya se acerca la época D. frio y tendrá que limitarse a vender en ella.  Este préstamo será devuelto en 4 cuotas.
Su gran sueño es que al llegar a mayor edad su bodega se convierta en una gran tienda donD. ella pueda sentarse a vender.
Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Mache y también al Comedor Popular Corazón D. María.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Teonila V. D. R. is 74 years old and lives in town square in Mache, on San Martin St. #113, Mache district, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department, Peru. She was able to attend school up to the first year of primaty school because as she tells us during her time "the parents will say that women should not learned how to read and write because it will allow them to write love letters to men and it was better that they didn't acquire that knowledge".

She has multiple businesses because she works them according to the season, during the rainy season, she stays at her small grcoery store and in summer time she goes to manufacture tiles which sell very well. She remembers with happiness when she received her first loan through Manuela Ramos. It was a 300 soles(Peruvian currency) loan. Rosa bought materials to expand her business and she paid it back in four months. "Manuela trusted me because I was not able to get credit through other banks, she said with a big smile.

With this 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, Rosa will continue to expand her grocery store because the cold season is approaching and she will have to limit herself to sell at the shop. This loan will be paid back in 4 installments. Her big dream is that when she becomes older, her shop will turn into a big store that she can sit down a be able to continue selling.

Rosa belongs to the Women of Mache Comunal Bank and also to the Heart of Mary Local Dining Room


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying diverse products (groceries)

loans.name: Juma Alfani's Sea Cliff C Group

texts.en:
Juma A., age 26, is married with a 1-year-old child. Juma is a carpenter, a business he started back in 2001. He works daily from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $250.

This will be Juma's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the first loan to increase his business and has since paid the loan back successfully. He intends to use this new loan to purchase raw materials so he can build more beds, cabinets, and dressing tables.

Juma will share this loan with his subgroup, Sea Cliff C. The group has 7 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Juma is the only male.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to build more products

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid R. was born in 1968, and is married with one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Agdam region. Vahid is in the Khirdalan settlement.

Ten years ago Vahid started a business. He sells building materials with a truck, and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for the truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the truck

loans.name: Rumana

texts.en:
Rumana G. is a married with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with the husband and her kids in Accra. She works very hard, because part of the responsibility for her kids rests on her shoulders, as a mother who wants to see her kids to the university level. She is now 23 years old. 

Rumana sells home products, like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales. Rumana is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her kids in school. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for support. 

Rumana belongs to the Boldness Trust community group. The group members guarantee a loan through repayment pledges and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank.  Felicitas is 56 years old and is married with nine children. She lives in Vilcashuaman Province, located five hours from the city of Ayacucho. 

Felicitas sells a variety of clothing, both traditional and modern, in Vilcashuaman’s regional markets. Felicitas also farms potatoes and quinoa. 

 Felicitas needs a loan of 2,100 soles to buy sneakers and hats.  Felicitas dreams of educating all of her children, of expanding her business and of offering a wider variety of merchandise. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas. 
Felicitas es casada, tiene 56 años y 9 hijos, Felicitas vive en la provincia D. Vilcashuaman que se ubica a 5 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Felicitas venD. ropa variada y también típica, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias D. la zona. Además Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura D. papas, quinua. 
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. zapatillas y sombreros. 
Felicitas sueña con educar a todos sus hijos, ampliar y surtir sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy sneakers and hats

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey T., 48, of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, has been growing rice and vegetable crops in her community for many years, a skill she leaned from her grandparents. She is married with five children, four single and employed, one married. Srey’s husband, Mr. Sheat, 47, is a local construction worker.

One her sons is a motorbike repairer who currently needs money to expand his business. On his behalf, Srey is requesting a loan for the purchase of motorcycle-repair materials.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Tujisaidie Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been a juice and bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to increase her stock for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Fatma is 21 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Salama, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To increase her stock by buying more items for her business.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich S., 46, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. Since 2004, she has been selling bananas and is able to make US$6 per day. Her husband, pictured here, is a motor-taxi driver and makes US$5 per day. This couple has six children, five of whom are in school and one who is too young to attend. Mrs. Pich S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 31-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ziad has owned an accessory shop since 1996. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan.
Ziad is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and sells beautiful accessories. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ziad decided on doing his business because there isn’t any other accessory shop in his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. works as a baker and trader at Kissi near Elmina. She has been in business since 2002 and sells such goods as bread and sauce pans. She is married with 3 children and received an education through elementary school. While Christiana is trading her goods, her husband is employed as a farmer. Christiana’s loan will be used to purchase additional flour, margarine and sugar which she will use for producing her goods. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house and also educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour, margarine and sugar.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet N. is the leader of the Kavule Effort women’s group, in Mukono. She is 39 years old and married with six children ages two to nineteen. She also cares for four orphans who attend school.

Juliet has a clinic that she has run for 14 years with her husband. They have a dream of building a hospital plus a residential house away from the clinic. Now they stay under the same roof as the clinic. For all the times she has taken loans, she has expanded her clinic. Juliet needs another loan to buy more medicines and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Buy more medicines for her clinic.

loans.name: Veaceslav

texts.en:
In 2005, Veaceslav started a small timber operation in the south of Moldova. Veaceslav's entry into the timber business was in the trade flow from Romania to Moldova at that time and he has since posted an impressive growth rate, particularly over the past two years.

During this period, Veaceslav has become one of the larger suppliers in the region. This strong business growth is the result of his strength in the three key dimensions of the business: sourcing, depth of product species, and marketing presence. He places a significant emphasis on quality control, and this is reflected in his quality management systems and procedures. His objective is to enhance value through providing superior service to his customers.

Veaceslav recognizes that it requires long-term commitment to improve forestry practices, so he has requested a micro-loan from Microinvest to purchase more logging and tree-felling equipment.

loans.use: To purchase more logging and tree-felling equipment

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza I Group

texts.en:
The committee Nueva Esperanza (“A New Hope”) was formed on July 2nd, 2008, and is made up of eighteen women from the city of Itá.  This group formed thanks to Mrs. Nancy S., who talked to a loan officer in the area about starting a group in the Women Entrepreneurs program.  She was very enthusiastic and anxious to be able to work with this program, and the group is now in their fourth cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya. 

The average credit given to an individual in the committee is 800,000 Paraguayan guarani.  The participants use their credit towards their respective activities.

1	Yohana V.--Clothing making/sales 
2	Francisca B.	--Clothing sales 
3	Graciela D.--Dressmaking
4	Elvira A.--Plant sales
5	Claudia C.--Food sales and recycling
6	Nancy S.--Clothing making/sales
7	Lidia S.--Small grocery store
8	Aída S.--Clothing, fruit and vegetable sales
9	Saturnina Benítez--Meat sales
10	María R.--Purchase and sale of recycling
11	Celsa J.--Fruit sales
12	Lorenza F.--Small grocery store
13	Teresa L.--General store
14	María D.--Food sales
15	Mirian C.--Fruit and vegetable sales
16	Silvia R.--Dressmaker
17	Justina G.--Clothing sales
18	Magdalena R.--Food sales

loans.use: The purchase of: materials for making clothes, grocery store merchandise, ingredients for making food, recycling products, meats, fabrics, fruits, vegetables, general store items, plants, etc.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 26 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Samer has owned a barber's shop for seven years. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase sinks and a new chair for his shop. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

Samer is successful because he is known for his good and talented work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Samer first started his business, he had financial issues. He set up as a barber because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase sinks and a new chair for his shop

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn B. is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Rodelyn owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily buying and selling vegetable products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rodelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetable products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetable products to sell

loans.name: Нурали

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Эрматов Нурали 39 летний молодой человек, отец четырёх детей. Он работает в колхозе трактористом, его заработная плата  очень низкая и не хватает на полноценное проживание. Поэтому  Нурали  с молодости занимается откормом и продажей скота. С данного бизнеса он имеет хороший доход , на осуществление домашних крупных расходов. Нурали хочет купить на полученный кредит корм и два молодых барана.
Он доволен всеми условиями организации и хочет продолжать сотрудничать с нами.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Jorge Domingos

texts.pt:
Jorge domingos J. nasceu na cidade da Beira (segunda capital do pais, no centro a 1200 km de Maputo) casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 4 e 18 anos dos quais 3 frequentam escola. Estudou ate 7 classe, tendo interrompido devido à doença que lhe atacou bastante neste ano. Para alem dos filhos sustenta seus irmãos enviando lhes dinheiro, mensalmente.

Saiu da Beira no ano de 1980 para cumprir o serviço Militar obrigatório na província de Maputo e desde lá nunca mais voltou para sua terra natal nem para outro ponto do pais.
É desmobilizado e trabalha como segurança na empresa G4, segurança a mais de 8 anos. Foi formado como militar neste distrito de boane (o distrito tem o um dos maiores quartéis do pais). Ganha como pensionista 1.500,00MT e 3.000,00MT na empresa de segurança.

Vive na casa própria e com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construção de uma casa de alvenaria. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo. Os outros créditos foram também para mesma actividade (8.000,00MT e 14.500,00MT).
Teve informações através de amigos e colegas que vivem neste distrito de boane.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos ou instituições similares e espera pagar o presente credito para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa e posterior apetrecha mento. De forma voluntária, concorda compartilhar a sua historia no site do kiva.
texts.en:
Jorge Domingos J. was born in the city of Beira (Mozambique's second capital, 1200 km away from Maputo in the middle of the country). He is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 18. Three of them attend school. He went to school until 7th grade, when he became ill and had to stop. In addition to his children, he supports his brothers, sending them money every month. He left Beira in 1980 to carry out his obligatory military service in Maputo, and hasn't left Maputo since then or returned to his hometown. He is no longer enlisted and has worked as a security guard at the G4 company for more than eight years. He was trained as a soldier in Boane, which has one of the largest barracks in the country. He gets a military pension of 1500 meticals a month, and earns 3000 meticals a month as a security guard. He lives in his own home, and plans to use the 15,000 meticals requested to buy construction materials in order to build a brick house. This is his third loan. His other loans were for the same purpose (8000 and 14,500 meticals). He learned about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues who live in Boane. He's never had a loan from other banks or similar institutions, and he hopes to pay off the present loan in order to request further assistance, with the goal of completing and furnishing his house. He has voluntarily agreed to share his story on Kiva's website.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a brick house.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrián V. vive con su esposa la señora Justina, ellos viven solitos ya que sus hijos todos ellos están casados, ella se dedica al hogar y atención del señor Adrián, por su lado el tiene un negocio de limpieza de zapatería establecido desde hace 3 años, el mismo construyo y diseño su estante para que sus clientes se sienten y el les pueda brindar su servicio, el motivo por el cual esta solicitando este crédito es para la inversión en la compra de mercancía para la limpieza de zapatos, tales como cepillos, pintura, grasas etc.
texts.en:
Adrián V. lives with his wife, Justina. They live alone because their children are all married. She devotes herself to the home and to taking care of Adrián. He has a shoe shine establishment. He has had it for three years. He built and designed his stand where his customers sit and he can provide his service. He is asking for this loan to buy merchandise like brushes, dye, and polish, etc. for cleaning shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cleaning products for his business

loans.name: Edelwesa

texts.en: Edelwesa B. is from the village of Catohugan, Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 41 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Edelwesa owns and operates a a variety or "sari-sari" store, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Edelwesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Edelwesa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma A. is from Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Vilma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month. In 2009, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
